text: A friend and I stopped here for a late night snack and beer. There were so many options that we were a little overwhelmed at first. We ended up getting the portobello mushroom sandwich. It was extremely savory and the perfect amount of food! I would definitely recommend coming here if you are with a large group full of different taste buds. Seating is available inside and out.

Until recently I thought I had found the best cheese curds in town--now that I've tried Tipsy Cow's, I know I have found them! Decent to above average beer selection and friendly staff make this a great place to check out on The Square.

I am a frequent visitor during lunch time on the weekends. Sometimes after work for a beer and burger. TP has an excellent selection of local and national craft beer. Bartenders have always been knowledgeable and willing to provide samples of beer. The food is exceptional. From burgers, sandwiches, to salads, the food is consistently above average. Tipsy Cow is one of my "go to" places to eat on the weekend afternoon after a nice bike ride. Great location off the square.

Cheese curds are a favorite of mine and these rank up there as one of the best. Good food, very creative selections on hand. I also tried the Tipsy Punch specialty drink; wasn't a huge fan of that but wouldn't oppose to trying it again. The bar area was smaller/more cramped than I expected and I didn't go into the actual dining area as there were a few scattered seats at the bar (was there on a Wed night about 7).

Great food, great prices! The guacamole bacon burger is my default (favorite burger in Madison), but I have friends who swear by the tipsy burger. Some of the best cheese curds and fries in town. Good beer selection too. This is the only review I've ever written, but Tipsy Cow is worth it.  Definitely go and enjoy.

My husband and I came here after work one day to try their truffle fries. We had heard lots of rave reviews and just had to give it a shot. The verdict? Good, but not great. I much prefer the Parmesan truffle cream fries over at DLUX.   That said, the prices were good - we went during happy hour. Service was subpar. The restaurant was pretty empty, but our server spent most of her time reading the paper and chatting with other staff.  I might go back to try other food, but if I'm craving truffle fries, you can find me at DLUX!

Best burger I have ever had in my life. We were visiting for our business trip and enjoyed their burger with 3 year aged cheese. Not too greasy but just right on the moisture. The cheese melts in your mouth and your just along for the ride. Wish I could have this everyday!

I really enjoy The Tipsy Cow. Their food is consistently good and they have a good selection of beers. You can't beat their deal on Mondays with half-off wings and half-off fries. The Korean BBQ fries are outstanding!

The place was very busy but we were seated quickly.  It is in the heart of Madison's theater district so parking was difficult.  I went for the fish fry.  For $10 (refreshing as opposed to $9.99) you get a three piece Spotted Cow battered cod, slaw, battered fries and rye bread (I always prefer marble rye but that's me.).  Also refreshing was that the portion size was very decent and not gut busting.  This place is a definite keeper.  Many raved about the cheese curds and they didn't disappoint.  You must try.  They also had goat cheese curds which I am now dying to try.    The beer selection won't disappoint.  Be sure to check out the chalk board for the specials.  For dessert we had the Pumking (8 1/2% alcohol).  OH my gosh.  I am not a pumpkin pie connoisseur but I wanted a slice while drinking the Pumking.    Service was excellent despite it being crowded and the tables too close together.  Definitely give it a try.

Service was OK. The waitress super nice. The starters and sides phenomenal however the burger was sub par. The restaurant allows families with children however I would not recommend it and smaller parties are probably best. My hubby loved the spotted cow beer, we were from out of town. All in all the place is good stop for lunch.
A fine, no-nonsense spot offering solid pub fare with friendly and efficient service. Not noteworthy in any real sense, but there is nothing wrong with that at all.

this place can't accommodate more than a 3 person party, so don't think you will enjoy trivia night with a group of friends. We had a rude chubby waitress who seemed too stressed out to be a waitress and literally bumped into me to get past me with a word! ick
Fantastic. Good service. Sitting outside was nice and the setting next to the capitol was amazing. Cheese curds were phenomenal. The burger and the bun were soft and delectable

One of the places in Madison where one can try locally grown food. Their chicken, either it's in the salad or chicken tenders, is the best I have ever had in USA. The fries are the best in Madison. I think they fry them differently, but I might be wrong. Their pickles tastes like something my Russian grandma would make. For those who did not like them, this is how real pickles with dill should taste like. Would go again and again and again
My favorite go-to for Madison food! The goat-cheese curds are to die for and the best in the city. They are always fast and allow you to order entrees and sides separately.

Formerly King and Mane, this restaurant (run by the same folk as at Lombardino's) ditched their former Tex-Mex tapas/small plates menu and name and rebranded themselves as The Tipsy Cow with an emphasis on Wisconsin comfort food and craft beer.  The interior has been updated a bit too, and it's hard to miss the Holstein-esque paint job at the front door on the corner.  Their menu is an 8.5 by 11 page with food on one side and drinks on the other.  As I mentioned, the food portion is Wisconsin comfort food.    Appetizers/Sides consist of things like cheese curds, cheese sticks, pretzels, Spotted Cow battered onion rings, all sorts of fries (blue cheese & bacon, truffle, chili cheese, and beer battered).    They have a couple options of soup and salad, and the entrees are all sandwiches of some kind, like burgers, sausages, turkey, grilled cheese, chicken, BLT, with the exception of a Friday fish fry.  There's also a few dessert choices.  The Tipsy Cow's menu puts some emphasis on local and Wisconsin-based ingredients, which I always consider a good thing.  Regardless of where I'm eating, the more local and fresh you can get the ingredients, the better.  The flip side of the menu is devoted to drinks, with craft/micro brews taking center stage.  Lots of locals like Ale Asylum, Lake Louie, New Glarus, Furthermore, Potosi and Oskar Blues, but also a decent selection of other U.S. beers.  There's also macros, imports, mixed drinks and wine.  They seem to have daily tap specials on the beer.  Stopped by around 2pm on a Thursday.  Not very busy at all, so I grabbed a table overlooking King St.  Looked like a decent selection of 6-8 taps, and Lake Louie's Warped Speed was on special for $3.50 a pint.  Wish I could have taken advantage of it.  Since it was kind of dead, service wasn't an issue at all.  I ordered a water, the Kielbasa sandwich, and a small order of the beer battered french fries.    The Kielbasa was Usinger's on a Clasen's sausage roll, with a whole grain mustard and bavarian sauerkraut.  Great synergy between the different flavors and textures, and the roll was a perfect match for the fillings.  As someone who cooks similarly on a regular basis, it was nice to find an alternative if I don't feel like cooking =)  The beer-battered fries' batter was very good as well, and the fries were cooked right on target.  I should have asked if they were using a Spotted Cow batter like they do for their onion rings.  Portions were good too, I still had a bit left on my plate.  Not bad for a $10 meal.  The typical American-sized potions are way too big for me, so this was a nice change from meals where I sometimes leave more than half of it for a to-go box.  With the popularity of the Old Fashioned nearby, I can see this place taking a similar route, as they share many of the same qualities.  We'll see if the service can keep up when it gets busy, but as this is a rebranding and not an entirely new restaurant I would assume that all the staff would need to do would be to adjust to the new menu.  5 stars for quality flavor of food, beer selection, price, and service.  Your mileage may vary on the service aspect though, as it wasn't busy at all when I was there.

I've gone to Tipsy Cow three times now & have always been impressed with the food however not by the waitstaff.  The waitresses I've had have all been attentive at the start of the meal however half away through they seem to disappear.  I waited 20-30 minutes during one visit to pay my bill & I seriously could not find my waitress..... Also the knowledge of the menu from waitstaff is poor.  They have a fun selection of beers but one waitresses could not tell me about a handful of them & instead of saying "Let me ask the bartender or Would you like a sample because I'm not familiar with that beer", she repeated "I really have no idea what that tastes like" & "Ya I'm not sure".   When it's my first visit to a new restaurant I like to hear the opinions from the staff on their favorite dishes & drinks, not lack of interest or knowledge in the menu. I think once the waitstaff here is up to par with the food there won't be much of anything to complain about!

Service was challenged on a crazy busy Friday night, but they delivered. Highlights:  Friday fish fry was great. Great, flaky fish and texture  and flavor on the fries. Pinto beans and sausage, with the taco plate, were excellent. Richest tomato soup we have had in a long time and the white curds were perfect with it.
Came here late night and they had $6 drafts of Apocalypse Cow. Awesome.
Lord help you if Don is your server. Only table he had, couldn't pull it off.  Food was still good, but service sucked balls.

Our experience with The Tipsy Cow would have been better had my wife and I not felt ill (nauseous) after our meal here. The service was slow; our food took seemingly forever to appear. Our appetizers and salad arrived with our entrees and my drink was forgotten.  Our server did eventually remember the ice tea and brought it out gratis.  Once the food did arrive, it was very tasty. The basket of onion rings we split were awesome and better than any we'd had before.  My wife ordered the grilled cheese with Nueske's bacon and 3yr cheddar. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with bacon and 3yr cheddar as well. Both were excellent. The salad with mixed greens was fairly dull and drowned in dressing. No tomatoes or other garnishes were added.  I would not return. Between the slow (though cheery) service, the after-effects of the meal, and the availability of better pub food closer to our home, this is one to move on from.
The cheese curds are some of the best I've had whenever I travel all across Wisconsin. The tipsy burger is also massive and delicious. Fast service too

One of the great places in Madison where one can try locally grown food. Their chicken, either it's in the salad or chicken tenders, is the best I have ever had in USA. The fries are the best in Madison. I think they fry them differently, but I might be wrong. Their pickles tastes like something my Russian grandma would make. For those who did not like them, this is how real pickles with dill should taste like. Would go again and again and again!
Love love Truffle Fries!! I can't enough of them. Drinks are great, food is great, friendly servers.

The server double charged my debit card with my ticket and another table's ticket. The server said it wouldn't go through. One week later, 8 different phone calls and even talked to the owner who was going to take care of it - the charge is still on my account. Bad business practice.

This was formerly Buggy's Diner, they opened in January 2016. Same layout and decor but they amped up on TVs as it's now a sports bar. There's also a large projector screen. By the front, there are 2 dart boards.   Coming here for dinner on a Tuesday night, it was quiet with several men having a drink at the bar and one at a booth. We were greeted by a friendly lone waitress.  Menu is the standard appetizers, wings, burgers, sandwiches and pub favourites. They have 3 South Asian curries that adds a twist! We ordered a buffalo chicken appetizer (deep-fried boneless chicken pieces) in honey garlic sauce ($9), and a beef and Guinness pie (beef stew topped with a flaky pastry, $12). The buffalo chicken was alright, can't go wrong with deep-fried breaded chicken pieces, and the cook served it on a bed of potato wedges by mistake :) The beef pie was a little disappointing. A peppery stew with a hint of Guinness and small pieces of beef, it could be better.   I imagine this place will be popular on a game day or to have a drink with a buddy. The light is too dim for me, my eyes were tired at the end of the meal, but it's good for watching the screens.   2.5 stars for the meal and the friendly server.
I love this place. They are always friendly, the cheese curds are the best as well as the chicken tenders.  This is one of my favorite restaurants in Madison.

Tipsy Cow was delish!  I went there with my husband and my parents for my birthday. The food was great the service was excellent.  We got a variety of items on the menu and loved them all. The coslaw that came with the fish was okay though.   I got the lamb burger, no egg add taziki sauce. It was amazing.   My dad got the Tipsy Burger, he said it was an excellent burger. And coming from a burger eater, that says alot.   Fish Fry, my mom and husband got. And they were both super happy about the fish. Not a fan of the coslaw, but it was OK.   Gator Bites, were awesome. Has a great spice to them. One of the better gator bites in Madison.   Onion Rings, large and tasty! The sauce it came with jived well together.   Gyro Fries, were a big hit with us too! Gotta try them.  So many things to try off there menu. Everything we had was great so I'm sure whatever you'll get will be tasty.

Went here a couple weeks ago and really enjoyed it. We had a good lunch at a reasonable price. The beer selection is olid (gotta love gumball head) and the truffle fries/tipsy burger combo is bomb. Unfortunately my second outing was bad. My friend wanted to grab a quick burger and my girlfriend and I figured we would join him for a beer. We got in there from the 90 degree heat outside only to realize it was almost a hundred degrees inside! You are new and its the beginning of summer! Get the a/c workin! We were promptly sat by the hostess and looked over the menu for 5 to 10 mins until we found what we wanted. 5 more mins passed and we watched the same three servers walk by our table maybe six times without looking at us. This is a like 10x10ft room with four tables. It wasn't busy. We decided to wait 5 more mins. The guy server looked at us and smiled, giving us hope. He then continued to pull out his phone and text in the corner. Bye bye. We left and opted for the great dane. Tipsy cow, get your act together. You could be successful with your good food and beer, but aweful service will put you under in this competative town.

I hate doing this....but it was so expensive. We waited for someone to come to the table for 10 min, ordered, & then waited another 25 for our food, on a Tuesday. Drink specials didn't go into effect until 8pm apparently, didn't say anything about it on the menu. I got a chicken sandwich and the bun was toasted, but too toasted, so the bottom was hard and just tasted like burnt toast. The chicken sandwich sounded good but it didn't have any flavor :( it was a normal sized sandwich and my boyfriend's burger was very small. Both cost $8 I believe, and didn't come with anything, which I thought was weird. So we got the $12 spinach & artichoke dip which was alright. My mule was $8 and was about a small 8-10 oz mug. For not so good food and drinks we spent $45. Too much for a joint like this in my eyes.

Great food, but horrible service! Previous to this most recent experience, I had eaten several times at Tipsy Cow. I decided to bring some friends that never experienced the food. The service had been tolerable; however, this time it was a new low. The hostess told us the wait would be 25 minutes and recommend Great Dane as a better place to eat. She was very persistent for the group of six of us to leave. Also, we arrived at 2:30 PM on a Saturday, which was slow during this time. The food is not worth the lack of service. I would recommend a different place to enjoy a meal. Maybe Great Dane as the hostess stated;-)

In my opinion, some of the best burgers in town. They have a burger with bacon and avocado that I dream about. Also, their truffle fries are very popular and crave worthy for many Madisonians.  The beer selection is on point and the service is attentive but not over bearing. Overall, I prefer this to the old fashioned for burgers and beer. Especially on a Tuesday (2X2 if you know what I mean)

The cheeseburger I had was juicy and delicious and made from quality ingredients. The cheddar was aged and sooooo good! Homemade pickles. Cheap too - $5, and a side of crispy fries was a buck extra. Service was fast during the busy Saturday night and the staff was really friendly. Great drink specials. Their menu mainly consists of bar food and Wisconsin comfort food, which is fine in my book. Will definitely be coming back.
The best Friday Night Fish Fry I have ever had! Friendly staff and great craft beer selection!

Everything too greasy. We had Tipsy Burger, "Portobello" Mushroom burger (which came as regular mushrooms) and onion rings and all were swimming I'm grease, just not appetising. I also posted a photo of the pool of fat left in the dish even from the mushroom burger.

After sifting through all of the yelp reviews, my partner and I were a little hesitant to try The Tipsy Cow. While the food seemed to be received well, there were quite a few poor service reviews that almost put us off.   We walked in at about 8 PM on a Saturday night, ready for the worst. While it was quite loud and packed, we were expecting that for a Saturday night. Miraculously, the hostess said the wait was only 25 minutes and our table opened up within 15 minutes of putting our name on the list. We had no problem getting the bartender's attention to get a beer while we waited.   The service continued to be spot on as we moved to our table. Our waitress was patient and friendly, even when I had to ask her to repeat herself 3 times because the place was so loud. We went all out with cheese curds, beer battered french fries, mike's pickles, and the Tipsy Burger. We were blown away! Everything was far better than even our highest expectations. The cheese curds were on par with The Old Fashioned's, widely believed to be the best in town. The french fries had a deliciously crispy exterior while maintaining the fluffy potato-y interior. I honestly thought that the "beer battered" part wouldn't make a difference but those are some of the best fries ever I've had. The pickles were fresh, crispy, and sweet, a perfect complement to all of the greasy food we were hoovering up.  Now for the Tipsy Burger. My god, that thing was greasy, messy, and everything I could ever want in a burger. You could tell from the first bite that the quality of the beef itself was a step up from most burgers I've had in Madison. The bacon was thick and cooked to the right level of crispiness. The cheese was smooth, melty, and in abundance. Finally, the special sauce added a creamy, zesty flair that really pulled the whole burger together. We also chose to throw on some of our pickles from our appetizer and, wow! The burger as a whole was even tastier than the summation of its parts. I can't wait to dig into my leftovers today!  I would highly recommend The Tipsy Cow to any burger, cheese curd, or french fry enthusiast in Madison. I think it rates up there with the other Madison burger champs such as The Old Fashioned, Cooper's Tavern, Dotty Dumplings, and Brasserie V.

Came here for lunch on a Wednesday.  Did not have to wait for a table.  The dining room was small, very small.  There were also tables in the bar area and outside.  They were out of goat cheese curds BOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  but the regular ones were pretty deelish.  My salad (pineapple, cilantro, nuts, avacado) was fabulous as was my husband's sausage sandwich with coleslaw on it.  Our server was nice.  Paid 44 dollars for 4 lunches plus tip (we all drank water though). I'd go back for sure.   PS.  Brought my baby and they did have a high chair for him.

Fries: some of the best I have ever, ever come across. Burger: juicy and delicious, a little greasy but in kind of a good way. But two gripes - the cheese curds were great but there was a super small portion for the $7 price tag. Second gripe was the "house salad". Comes with a "buttermilk raspberry viniagrette".The dressing was way too tangy for me but whaddyagonnado; and it didn't have "stuff" in it, it was just lettuce.  But I can't wait to go back and try the other sandwiches, they looked amazing. UPDATE - 1/4/12 - since then, I have had the warm mushroom and goat cheese salad which was fabulous, and today I had the most amazing hot ham n cheese ever. The bread was generously buttered and toasted so it was a delicious, crisp, buttery delight, with extremely flavorful aged cheddar cheese, melted in with the very thinly sliced ham - SO GOOD. Paired with a cup of their amazing chili (I consider mine award-winning, but theirs is equally as good, with a completely different flavor) made for an awesome lunch. One suggestion would be to have a cup of chili and half sandwich option - It would make the lunch less pricy and would then be the perfect amount of food for lunch. I mean, I ate all mine, but I certianly didn't NEED all that food. :) Simply lovely.

This place is. The. Worst.  First of all, I walk in and take my seat. Who  has assigned seating anymore? 5 min l8tr I'm told I can't sit there anymore! WTF!?! Then, I take a seat at the bar. Bartender is awful. Slicked back hair, too defined of a part. Someone is elitist. Can't a girl order a whiskey and close out her tab? Is that too much to ask? $10 min? Why the drinks so cheap? Dat whiskey diet doe... Did the trick.  Sincerely,  Basic white b*tches.

This was my first bar I ever went to in Madison and even though there are so many great places, I still keep coming back to here. Though the food is a bit greasy, the staff is excellent (4 of the 5 bartenders I've had have been outright hilarious and lots of fun) and the smell of chocolate chip cookies wafts over the bar area... what's not to like? My boyfriend likes their beer list, I like their wine list, and thus we will keep coming back on quiet Sundays for day drinks and football watching.

Really loved the atmosphere here and they have a great drink selection! The food was great too if you are looking for a good casual dinner.. The truffle fries are soooo good and I would recommend getting those, everything was really good and I would go back for drinks or food again!

I stop in for lunch occasionally on a week day.   I'm usually in a hurry and the staff serves me quickly and efficiently.    Today I ordered the chili and it was probably the best I have ever eaten.    I'm sure it would be a nicer place for a more leisurely meal or happy hour.

OMG!  This place is awesome!  Mike's pickles and the fried cheese curds are fabulous!  The Tipsy Burger is, without a doubt, the best burger I've ever had.  Truffle fries are to die for!  Even the grilled cheese was spectacular.  My only problem was I couldn't eat enough to satisfy my curiosity.  Would love to try the Spicy Slaw Dog.  A nearby table ordered one, it looked very appetizing, I was stuffed.  Our server, Laura, was very friendly and attentive.  The restaurant was very clean and inviting.  Everything arrived just as quickly as you would expect.  No complaints!  Next time we're in Madison, The Tipsy Cow will definitely be on our list.

We sat out on the patio on a great summer day.   The beer selection is very good with many microbrews that are local and delicious.   I had the signature Tipsy Cow burger, and it was cooked perfectly and was one of the best burgers in Madison that I have tried.  The toppings were fresh and the service was prompt and friendly.  The truffle fries were decent but not extremely special.  I would definitely recommend The Tipsy Cow.

$3 PBR fish tacos were delicious!   Nice twist on the usual fish tacos because the fish is actually beer battered fried fish.  We also ordered a side of onion rings and fries, both were good but put us over the top for grease.  Next time, I'd order a couple of fish tacos, and maybe a salad instead.  Service was good but also a little a slow considering there were only two other tables of customers at the time.

I have loved this place for a long time! Everytime I go I walk away satisfied - that's not easy for me!  They keep the menu fresh and new. This time I ordered the guacamole burger (on toast -instead of the bun). They accommodated me with no problems.  The burger was the best I've had in a very long time. Then I had the goat cheese curds - just amazing! I try to eat here as often as I can and would recommend this place to anyone!
Busy and cozy! We sat by the window, good view! We took alligator bites and cheese curds. Only one bathroom, single person at a time.

Our experience to the Tipsy Cow was reason enough not to go back.  We were seated behind the main door, next to the bar and bathroom.  This shouldn't even be a seat.  Too cramped and  we kept getting bumped into.  The bathroom door doesn't close softly - extremely loud.  Just a really uncomfortable spot removed from the rest of the seats inside and outside.  Our waitress was not kind or polite.  We ordered.  She forgot our order of fries.  When our burgers came she put onions on the burger when I asked for none.  We felt like she wasn't even listening to us or interested in her role at all.  The cheese curds were decent, but the rest of the food was soggy in grease and was not appetizing.
This is my favorite place to get a burger in Wisconsin and Illinois. Whenever we come back to visit family we always make sure we eat here.

I wish I could review the food at this place but my two attempts to eat here over one weekend failed miserably.  First time: about 10:30 pm on a Friday night. No hostess to be found so we wandered around until a server stopped to give us a dirty look and ask if we needed something. She took no small pleasure in telling us they only served drinks after 10 pm.Rude! Went to Brocach down the street and had excellent beer and snacks.  Second time: about 6 pm on a Sunday. Closed. Went back to Old Fashioned for cheesy treats.  Menu looked very good, so I'm disappointed I didn't get to try it...oh well, though.

Fun atmosphere, we went on a trivia night (yelp starz killed it). Kinda noisy but easy to talk amongst yourselves. We ordered a fruitsman beer, and a oskars saison with alligator bites marky Mark style (that means buffalo sauce for non foodiez). Beer was great with reasonable prices. Alligator bites were overwhelmed by the buffalo sauce so the true taste profile is unknown. Also, the sauce that came with bites may have added relief or more heat to bites. Crowded but easy to navigate bar, super slow service, and not really attentive.   For this food starz has given tipsy cow a solid 3 (not a 3+, or the less desired 3-. Moderate at best).

This was our first time and it was a busy Friday night. We sat in the bar area which was fine. It was a rainy night so outside was not an option. Food was great, we had wings, sour cream and onion fries, buffalo chicken sandwich and a cheeseburger. My only complaint is that the waitress did not write down our order and we did not get what we ordered. It was corrected but could  of had been avoided. Great beer and food.

Some friends and I came to try out The Tipsy Cow, but I can't comment on it because nobody ever talked to us. We walked in, there was a sign that said, "Please wait to be seated". We stood there for about 10 minutes without being helped. It was a little busy, but we would've liked to be acknowledged. We wound up leaving and walking to a different restaurant without any employee saying anything to us. Strange.

We stopped in here for an hour while waiting for our table to open up at Old Fashioned up the street.  I'd have liked another day to come back to eat here too, because the food I saw being served to the bar patrons looked pretty good.  There was a good selection of beers on tap, and my only negative was that I'd have liked their beer selection to be more Wisconsin centric.  That being said, the regular customers are locals, and having some out of state brews is a good idea.  It's definitely the sort of place I like to find myself, and would go back in a heartbeat if I find myself back in Madison.

My BF and I stopped for a drink this evening on our way to another restaurant for dinner.  The bartender could not have been more indifferent.  We won't be going back to eat there no matter how many good food reviews I read.

I went here for lunch with my dad and we each ordered a cup of the tomato soup, which was to die for.  It had a little bit of sweetness and smokiness to it and was topped with fresh cheese curds.  We split the 1 x1 made into a tipsy burger.  The cheese on was delicious and the homemade pickles were crisp and sweet, also very good.  We also each ordered a fish taco (thursday special).  It came with hefty piece of fried fish with a chipotle sauce, slaw and pico de gallo.  I will definitely go back for all of it.  The only problem is you leave smelling of grease.

The tipsy burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. Very good beer selection and my server, "Claire" well she was great as well. When I come back through Madison I will definately be stopping back here.

I love the tipsy cow.  The food is consistent.  It is usually less busy than other capital restaurants.  My husband has crowned the tipsy burger his favorite in Madison.  The cheese curds are fabulous. What more could you want?

Blows the Old Fashioned out of the water.  My office is less than a block away, and I have gained probably 5 pounds from the beer-battered fries alone. Not to mention the PBR-battered fish tacos, the satisfying and well-crafted Tipsy Burger, or any other sumptuous morsel off their menu. Hell-o, weekly specials.  The place is cozy, the bartenders are friendly, and the place is always bustling. It does get very busy very suddenly and wait times tend to be long, what with the no reservation policy. But hey, you've got some nice Wisconsin beers to sip while you wait for the servers to finish hyperventilating in the back.

Fish fry was not good. With such a thick beer batter (which I generally enjoy), you better not overcook the fish. Unfortunately, the fish was left in the fryer too long. This, combined with the fact that the fish itself was below average, resulted in a pretty disappointing meal. Luckily, the fish fry was only $9 (at lunch) which is very reasonable for a good size portion.   I had high hopes for this place. Next time, I'll have to try the burger.

Great food when they have it. They seem to run out of goat cheese curds a lot.  Don't go on trivia night or you won't get good service. They act like you're an inconvenience when you want to eat before trivia starts.

Not always easy to get a table but we'll worth the wait. Everything I've ever eaten has been phenomenal. After having a tipsy cow burger, All other burgers pale in comparison. The beer selection is great too!

Not a bad option for a bit of bar food! Very busy on a Saturday night, at least until about 9 or so. Nice variety of sandwiches, and a lot of different fry options to try- we enjoyed the sour cream and chive fries quite a bit. Also, the pretzel appetizer beats Coopers Tavern's by a mile.
We had a great time here. It was fun, laid back, and good food. We were seated on the patio and a thunderstorm rolled in but were able to grab seats at the bar. Definitely would go back.

Very flavorful. Good quality food and good service. I can't wait to go back and check out other items on the menu. There was 4 of us and we all had something different. Flavor and quality was how we all described our experience at The Tipsy Cow.

Would've given it four stars except the service is a little iffy. Tipsy burger and the alligator bites were both on point, though the bites were a little small for the price. That burger though. I can't tell if it was cause I was starving and cold but that sure hit the spot. The house made pickles are pretty killer too. No sides come with the burgers just fyi

I have now found THE #1 BEST CHEESECURDS in Madison - no small feat, given the competition.  Batter is light, cheese is yummy fresh - perfect!   Tipsy Cow also has one of the very best burgers in town.  Eager to return!

I have never gone to Tipsy and been disappointed, let me just say that. Highlights are as follows:  *Pickles. They come with your basket (BASKET BONUS) or you can get them as an appetizer. If you get them as an app, make sure you have a decent size group with you. Or make sure you really like pickles. If you really like pickles, you'll really really like their pickles. Paragraph on pickles complete.  *Truffle fries. Melt in your goddamn mouth.  *Green goddess dressing. I'd bathe in it if it weren't so humid right now.  *Specials. They circulate through some pretty creative, limited-time items on a fairly regular basis and I usually order off that menu. The last couple of munchies I tried on special were Goat Cheese Curds and a Caprese Sandwich. Both were way good and I actually think those Goat Cheese Curds were better than their regular ones. Make 'em permanent, make me happy.

Their fries are awesome. So many combinations. I recommend going in on mondays to get their fries half off. Also try getting their fries with buffalo and ranch , instead of buffalo and blue cheese. Worth a try!

I've been a few times now, and I feel like it's time to review.  Good things first: 1) Great beer list  2) Weeknight specials are steals  3) Bacon blue cheese fries 4) Pretty solid commitment to using local products  The not so good: 1) Most tap beers are $6 2) Service ranges from frantic, overbearing, adderall'd frat boy to absent.  (read: I've never had good service here) 3) It gets LOUD  For the most part, Tipsy Cow does an OK job but the service needs some improvement.  All the taps are usually great selections, but $6 is kiiiiiiiiind of ridiculous.  They have a tap of the day (or week or month or something) that's usually $3.50, but it tends to be the least desirable on the list.  The food is nothing to rave about, but it's a step above similar places.  I'll definitely be back - I'm a sucker for 1/2 price wings and fries - but Tipsy Cow still needs a lil' tweaking.

Awesome wings, had the tipsy bbq ones and some regular fries - I lucked out and it was half off of wings and fries night (Monday's) and I paid $12 for 2 beers, wings and French fries - no complaints whatsoever!

Good food and good fun. I enjoyed their patio seating and incredibly large craft brew selection. The food was also very good. I recommend the fried curds. It can get quite busy but the staff handles that in a pretty timely fashion.

We decided to try this place based off a news article naming the Tipsy Burger as the best burger in Wisconsin.  Hmm, I think the person who wrote the article missed Dotty's.  Anyhow, went here with my husband and son.  Husband and I each had a Tipsy Burger per the article's recommendation and our son had the kid's burger.  We also ordered onion rings and fries.  Burgers were okay, but were swimming in grease.  Onion rings were drowning in batter.  Fries were nondescript.  The biggest issue we had was the service.  The waitress dropped off our food and disappeared for the entirety of the meal.  She didn't check back on us once and we needed drink refills, etc.  We timed it and she didn't come back to our table for 30 minutes after dropping our food off...  After we were finally able to pay our check we found out why the lack of service - all staff were up front watching Badger Basketball.

Tried to "stop in" here on a Saturday around 6:30, but should have known it would have a long wait like every other restaurant right around the capital. We out our names in and got a drink elsewhere, as the bar was packed, and were texted to come back in 45 minutes.  We were seated at a bar table next to the window and began to peruse the drinks section. Unfortunately the drafts are only listed on the board behind the bar and I had to rather awkwardly scurry over/get in the waitresses way to look at it. I ended up getting a madtown nutbrown (bottled) and my boyfriend got a crown and Sprite. They were very generous with the spirits!  We started with the pretzels app because we were craving them, and they were as good as pretzels can be for not being house made.  As we continued on to ordering food go dinner we were both struck by the enormity of it. Being on one page and in tiny font, it was hard to focus our eyes on any one thing. With about 6+ kinds of fries, all that sound delicious, it seems as though different menu items could be better grouped. On a side note, sandwiches also do not include a side.  We ended up ordering a grilled cheese, chicken fritters, and sour cream and onion fries to split. Again, everything was yummy but not anything I'll remember forever. The grilled cheese had garlic aioli on it, which I love and discovered recently, but it was overflowing. The boyfriend really enjoyed the sour cream and onion fries, and we took them home to reheat.  Overall, good and unpretentious food. I plan to come back eventually and try out something else, probably on a weeknight.
Yum! Great beer list. Definitely get the cheese curds! Had both the grilled cheese and the gauc bacon grilled cheese. Both were excellent cheese explosions. Worth the visit for sure.

It's good for what it is and they have a couple of vegetarian options. The bread they use for the sandwiches is pretty good. I tried their portabella sandwich and the aioli sauce was perfect for it. They also have a grilled cheese for about $6.50. Part of the chalked in decorative message refer to Monty Python's Holy Grail in combination with cow-related humor in honor to the restaurant's name. They have several beers on tap. Right by Capitol Square and a hop from Colectivo.

This place has the potential of being good but it's a hit and miss place for me.  Last time I ate here my burger tasted and smelled like seafood. Which is not a good thing when you are eating beef.  Keep trying tipsy.

This should not be taken as a definitive review of the Tipsy Cow as I was in for one beer in the middle of a music festival. The Tipsy Cow is about the fifth attempt at a bar in this location with little changing in between. The staff were great on a very busy night. The decor is bar like, nothing spectacular. Lots of beer on tap but I did not have a chance to sample widely. I'd try it again before drawing a final conclusion.

This is a fun place for a bite to eat and some beers.    Food: A nice mixture of pub grub with sandwiches, tacos and appetizers. If you are looking for a full on entree, this isn't the spot. Everything I've had there has been well executed.  Beer: 99% craft beer, fresh, poured in proper glassware and reasonably priced.  Ambiance: Just a fun pub. Not divey but not uppity.

This review is only for the bar. They have a great selection of beers on tap. The spotted cow is a MUST try. Its smooth and light similar to Blue Moon, but without the citrus, similar to pale ale. Service was quick. Crowded at the bar, but eventually you'll get a seat if you scout who's leaving.

Have you ever eaten somewhere and ordered something so good that you re-order it every single time you revisit?? This is my place. And the Tipsy Burger is my 'usual'. I might as well tell the waitstaff that I don't need a menu! When you find something this good, what's the point in even being tempted by anything else? I think it's the local beef from Knoche's that makes it. My sister swears it's the brick cheese. Whatever it is, I've sworn my love and allegiance to this burger for all eternity.  Since the burgers are served a la carte, I have branched out and tried some of the different sides. Onion rings are good. Buffalo bleu cheese fries are GREAT! Also, although small, the tap beer selection here is pretty stellar. They usually have one or two things on tap that you'd be hard-pressed to find anywhere else.

You can't go wrong eating at the Tipsy Cow, we had the Friday night Fish Fry. While most of their menu items have sides separate this dish does come with sides. Had we realized that it is likely we would not have ordered a side of fries. Great beer selection, friendly waitstaff - I will definitely be back.
It was nice & good, but I wasn't blown away. Everyone liked what they ordered. The cheeseburger was very good. I'd go back, but it wouldn't be on the top of my list.

My favorite burger in Madison. Tipsy cow is a restaurant on the square with both a seating area and bar. The service is timely and courteous, drinks are high quality and of wide variety,  and food is definitiely better than those around the square.   A couple of highlights to emphasize here. One is obviously the tipsy burger, it has been recognized at the national level as one of the best cheeseburgers in the United States. The other is the truffle fries, which have an addicting/cant put it down flavor. Finally the cheese curds, ask for them to be tossed in buffalo sauce.   There are nightly specials on the menu, where you can get a popular food item at discount and a speciality menu for those who dont like monotony in their food options. Also a trivia night.    I always leave feeling like Tipsy Cow hit the spot.

We dashed over to Tipsy Cow after the Badger game, because we didn't want to wait an hour for a table at Old Fashioned. We got a table right away, and the service was in point! It's not 4/5 in terms of all restaurants ever, but it's 4/5 for being quick, fancy bar food.   My friends from Chicago and New York insist that the prices are super reasonable for the quality. My veg friend got an asparagus-egg sandwich and was really impressed! I ordered a small gyro fry, and it was a generous portion. The gyro was a little skimpy, but you'll enjoy it if you want a salty side.   We all agreed that the curds were to die. On par with Old Fashioned. If you're planning a curd crawl soon, put this place on the list.

Went here for trivia night on a Monday.  It was surprisingly busy and we had to wait a good 30 minutes for a table for 7.  We sat at the bar while we waited and the bartender indulged us by letting us sample some beers before making a decision.  When we were finally seated, our waitress was quick to take our orders.  I got the carnitas fries (on Mondays, all fries are $5!!) and devoured as much as I good as quickly as I could.  They were very tasty, but I would prefer the meat to be in smaller chunks and more pico/queso/other toppings.  I tried my friends truffle fries and while they do have a distinct taste to them, but I thought they were good. I also wish they listed beer prices.  I inadvertently ordered a $7 beer and I wouldn't have ordered it if I had known how much it was. It was hard to hear the trivia guy at times.  Most people in the dining area were there for trivia and would quiet down, but the tables that weren't continued chatting (as was their right) and the mic wasn't loud enough to carry over their conversations at times. I'd be back again; I've had their PBR fish tacos and they are to DIE for!
Best place I visited in Madison, hands down, and I went to a lot of places. Unpretentious, fun, casual local bar with intriguing microbrew choices on tap. Bonus points for cute cow decor!

The service was fast and friendly and the food was typical madison pub food: Burgers and fried things.  Since I wasnt in a burger mood I got the chicken tenders and they were surprisingly flavorful and juicy.  Other than that the Tipsy Cow is nothing to really gawk over.

This was a bit of a hole in the wall but was a nice surprise.  After a long day of training, I wanted something quick and easy, this was perfect.  The truffle fries were great. Rich, like you expect from truffle oil. The pickles, yummy. The tomato soup was spicey and sort of smokey at the same time. My friend had the goat cheese curds and they were an excellent surprise.  Also, my friends each had the kielbasa which was the special for 1/2 off. This was a huge amount of food for under ten dollars. A great discovery, I highly recommend.  Oh, and a great beer selection with samples from the tap. Get the truffle fries!

Farm to Table High End Well Lit Dive  So my wife and I are trying to squeeze in as much as we can during our 6 day stay. We walk by the Tipsy Cow and stop. After a brief discussion. we go in. Nothing really fancy to this joint and I would considering it a high end dive. We sit at the bar and get a couple of drinks. We look at the menu and my wife zooms in on the Blue Cheese and Bacon fries. We order that. As a continue to read the menu it becomes clear of the Farm to Table vibe this place has. From the special bacon, to ham to cheese this theme runs true here. I love that concept and we really don't have a lot that in a South Florida.   The Food  The fries come and they are pretty good, but nothing special. I then order the Ham and cheese sandwich and my wife gets the Kabasa which comes in a roll.  All the entrees do NOT come with sides, that's where the high end dive comes into play. Everything is ala carte. Our food comes out and it's looks damn good, I know what you are thinking, WTF is a hot ham and cheese sandwich. Dude this was some good eats. Some pickle slices came on the side and I decided to add them on my sandwich. Great move. The pickles, which the bartender said was homemade, had a sweet bite to them which added a great contrast to the melted sharp cheddar. mustard, and ham.  I had a bite of the kabasa and it had a good snap to it. I wish my wife got the Sauerkraut on it because it would have been a prefect couple.   Ambiance  Looks like a working persons pub. Watching the employees walk up and down a flight of stairs to go to and from the kitchen made me think of a working persons pub. Good solid menu and a decent beer selection makes this place hum. Our bartender was very nice as I pestered him to turn up the jukebox. Jukebox junkie here:)   Verdict   Not to shabby. If I have time I'd love to come back and try the burgers.  No reason to tell them I sent you since I'm visiting your town so Stay Hungry!
Amazing food and great service. The carnitas fries are a must. Definitely worth the long drive.

MLK Day, 2018. Despite the fact that there were already three inches of snow on the ground and more snow was steadily falling, my friend and I were determined to go to happy hour after work. So we took an Uber to Tavernakaya, which had a happy hour we had previously really enjoyed. After a near hazardous Uber ride in snowy conditions, we got out of the car and trudged through thick snow on the sidewalk, eager to warm ourselves up with some sake and pork buns. To our utter dismay, Tavernakaya was closed. Our fault for not checking before since it was a holiday but we were still distraught.   "There's a bar," I said, pointing straight to the Tipsy Cow. I'd been there once before for fries and beer and liked it enough that I started trudging toward it right away. My co-worker and I settled in at the bar and both ordered a bourbon peach mule. It was happy hour so specialty cocktails were $2 off, beer was $1 off, and wine was $5 a glass. We were safe. We had made it. The bourbon peach mule was delicious -- the peach adding just the right note of freshness and the bourbon was strong enough that you could taste but not so strong that it overpowered the delicate peach and ginger beer flavors. It was, in short, just what we needed on a Monday where it seemed nothing was going our way. We were a bit hungry so we decided to order some wings and fries - both half off during happy hour, making an order of 6 wings only $3 and a large order of fries only $2. I ordered the honey harissa wings and my coworker had the parmesan peppercorn. Both were great -- lots of meat, my wings had a smokey yet sweet flavor, and the parmesan peppercorn ones were crispy and flavorful. The fries were crunchy, and the cheese sauce that accompanied them was dairy perfection. Our bartender was friendly and attentive, serving us waters before we asked, refilling waters before we asked, and being prompt with splitting checks and making change.   Thank God we live in Madison, home of so many bars that even if one is closed, there's another one right down the street. And thank God for the Tipsy Cow for strong drinks, good wings, and a cozy bar to hole up in during a snow storm.

Came here for dinner last night and we were pretty impressed. So many items off their menu sound so delicious but there's no way we could order and eat all of them at once without being wheeled out in a wagon. We started out with some cheese curds. Our waitress was nice enough to let us do a half order of the original cheese curds and half of the goat cheese. I would totally skip the original all-together. Not that I don't love cheddar/mozz blend but the goat cheese ones are packed with SO much flavor. It would be a missed opportunity. We also ordered the gyro fries and burgers. The Gyro fries are so filling and its all my "drunk food" dreams come true. The burger I ordered was one of their specials, it was the goat cheese & 3 year cheddar burger (yes more goat cheese). I will say even though it was good, I was expecting the burger to be thicker (more meat pleeeease). Over all though, I'm excited to return for more apps and sammys.

I've eaten here a few times now and never been disappointed. It's hard for me to stay away from burgers, and the "Tipsy Burger" was fantastic, as are their cheese curds.  They have good nightly drink specials, especially for Fridays ($2.50 shots of Jameson and $3 Ale Asylum pints? Come on!)  The ambiance is good, the wait staff is above average, and the layout of the bar/restaurant is fun.   Overall, I definitely recommend it.

The Tipsy Cow was my first downtown dining experience when I moved to Madison. I was looking forward to fun local meal. I must say that it was a bit of a let down. The Cheese Curds were amazing, and I would definitely recommend them. However, my meal, a lime chicken sandwich was not very good at all. I'm willing to try it again, because it is a fun place - I'd definitely just want to try something different on the menu.  On a side note, I had an amazing waitress! Her name was Jill and she was the most delightful person I've met in a long time. She worked very hard to help my Mom pick out a local beer that she would like, and was overall super friendly and attentive. If you go there, definitely sit in her section!

I feel like The Tipsy Cow is the forgotten family member to The Old Fashioned.   They have phenomenal food- the cheese curds and fried pickles are a must every time I go. The beer selection isn't as lengthy as you'd expect, but the options are nothing short of delectable. The Tipsy Cow is a pretty representation of a Wisconsin bar scene.  I've ordered a hamburger from here and was surprised it didn't come with fries (that's where the curds and pickles come into play). Prices are a bit higher than you'd expect, but the quality outdoes itself. Being a New Yorker, I'd say overall fair.  They don't have many specials from what I've seen, but they do have a happy hour.
Great bar!!  Best cheese curds in the state!!! I'm a fried cheese curd connoisseur and I'm calling it like I see it.

This place told us we had a 45 minute wait, but then promptly ran after us when we left the restaurant telling us we had a spot. Nice surprise, but don't know what would've happened.  Cheese curds are alright. I got the fish (cod) and it was only alright. Pretty greasy and I picked it apart. Comes with a side of slaw and fries.   Service was good! Food was okay. Definitely going to try other things if I come again.  Can be relatively loud/obnoxious because of the bar.

stopped by in madison on my way back to chicago from baraboo. 1st time went to tipsy cow. I ordered buffalo chicken burger, it was okay, nothing so special. the price is pretty reasonable. i gave 3 stars because the serving was pretty slow, we had to ask for water everytime, i think they were under-staff. That was pretty annoying for me.

One of my favorite spots in Madison for casual dining. Living within walking distance of the Capitol for many years, dinner at tipsy followed by a cigar at Maduros is pretty much my happy place.   The burger has made Madison Magazine's best burger list I believe, and for good reason. The chicken sandwich is also outstanding. Their wings are sneaky among the best in Madison (accompanying bleu cheese dressing is awesome). For any of you that dig goat cheese (who doesn't?), they have goat cheese curds. Get them.   If you haven't yet been, go here for lunch or dinner sometime. You will not regret it.

Stopped by The Tipsy Cow when we were told The Old Fashioned would be an hour wait. We were not disappointed. Had the Mediterranean sandwich and side salad. Both were fantastic. The sandwich had a very tasty pesto and the vegetables were cooked perfectly. It was topped off with the creamiest goat cheese...delicious. Salad was fresh, fresh , fresh and their house dressing was lite and creamy. My daughter and husband shared a basket of fries and there were plenty for me to steal one or two without them feeling like they were being cheated. My daughter had the chicken wings while my husband had the BLT. He indicated the thick cut bacon was cooked perfectly. Total bill was around $40.

My girls and i wanted to eat like drunk man so we made a reservation for this place for happy food, ex; fried food... We each order 2 appetizers and beer, you should of see our face when all the food arrived, i mean we started eating with our hand and everything.  Now going back to the review, the place is pretty chill, nice music, the food was delicious and the service was fast. The waitress was very kind and quick. The food was so good I forgot to take picture, if you go definitely order the cheese curds, the onion rings and the wings.

Tipsy Cow is bomb. Super friendly, attentive wait staff, DELICIOUS food across the board and very reasonable prices. I came here with a large group and everything we ordered was amazing. The cheese curds are a must. We also really enjoyed the truffle fries, Tipsy Chicken Salad (love radishes!) the portabello sandwich and of course, the Captial Brewery beers. Thanks for an absolutely wonderful meal. Tipsy Cow is reason enough to come to Madison. Take a lovely walk around the capitol building after dinner to burn off some calories.

My husband and I recently visited Madison from KCMO and this bar/restaurant was recommended as a good place to meet up for dinner and drinks with friends. We went in at 4:30pm on a Tuesday to see if they would be able to accommodate 6 or so people at 5:30pm. They said they don't take reservations but would see what they could do, and they did set aside a table for us. I really appreciated their accomodating us. I ordered the grilled ham and cheese. It was really thick with ham, and really greasy. There was a unique flavor I couldn't identify and the server told me it was a gourmet mustard. It was smoky/bitter. We had also ordered fried cheese curds for the table, and they are also pretty greasy (I guess what should you expect from "fried", right?) Husband had the fish tacos and they were delicious. I enjoyed my first taste of Spotted Cow beer. I would recommend the Tipsy Cow as a go to place for anyone visiting Madison.

while in town for a conference, we were wandering around state street and the Capitol for our last night in Madison. my buddies and i have some interesting culinary allegiances: i'm an omnivore who was desperate for some vegetables at the end of an indulgent (cheese-curd-overdose) trip, my friend is la staunch carnivore who strictly does not eat any vegetables or healthy foods whatsoever, and our other buddy is a vegetarian.   we walked into this place because we couldn't resist its name, and we ended up being so happy that we did. among the three of us, we ordered the spring green salad (a special), the asparagus and egg open-faced sandwich, a side green salad, the tipsy chicken sandwich (crispy), and the tipsy burger. all of us were incredibly satisfied with our meals; the food was excellent and spoke exactly to each of our specific needs. we particularly liked how you can get half-orders of the apps or the salads, since the sandwiches don't come with sides.   the best part of the meal, however, was our amazing waitress, Katherine. she was incredibly friendly, attentive, and made us feel like she was genuinely happy to make sure we had a positive experience. towards the end of our meal, two other buddies showed up and wanted to join us; when they found an outside table and we thought we'd have to cash out and start a new tab, she just let us migrate out to the patio and continued to serve us. she really was a gem and made sure our last night in Madison was a great one.  wish we could be back to frequent this place, and over-tip Katherine!!!, all the time.

So rating this place on the food and overall atmosphere, not just our experience because our table was horrible right next to the hostess stand and people were all up in our personal space by the bar, stairs, and hostess. The food was really good! We had a few appetizers, cheese curds were amazing, probably the best yet in Madison. We had the special kielbasa corn dogs with Cajun sauce which were amazing, way over priced @ $8 for 5 small pieces, but tasty! Finally we had an half order of fried zucchini which was petty good. For meals I got the tipsy burger with fried onions which was great, and my wife got a ham and cheese sandwich special called the he jimmy I think. Overall great food but avoid the table right behind the hostess stand, almost made me snap on some people and i am a very easy going guy.
Average Wisconsin bar food.  If you're looking for a good micro-brew selection and greasy eats, it's a good bet.  The hour wait was not quite worth it, but I'd go back...

Nice selection of tap beers and the fries with truffle oil and a dipping sauce were awesome. Other menu items looked great, but we had another destination in mind for dinner.  Would go again next time I am around the capital.

We stopped in on a Friday night about 8pm, were told it would be about an hour wait.  Ended up being only about 20 minutes.  Ordered the BLT and the cod fish fry.  Food arrived very quickly and was a great meal.  Would definitely stop in again when in the area.  Enjoyed the intimate atmosphere in the dining area.

Great food and fast friendly service.  Would go there again the next time I'm in town.  Only went because of the good reviews on here and is worth the time and money. Parking can be a challenge but there is a parking ramp near by that we used.

I've been to Tipsy Cow a few times, but it had been a while since I've been there last.  So this weekend when it was suggested for some post-brunch drinks, I said, "why not?"  Their beer list is fairly extensive and varied.  I like that it is Wisconsin beer driven.  What could go wrong?   The bartender.  I don't know if the guy was new or just clueless, but I do know that he was awful and mopey.  His tap list, which is written on a chalk board, was grossly out of date.  He stated two beers were no longer available.  Upon inspection over half of the board was wrong.  He also poured what seemed to be 1/2 a keg down the drain while trying to pour my pint.  Adding to my ire, after my friend asked a legitimate question about a beer he proceeded to mansplain to her what an IPA was.  Not cool bartender, not cool. So why do I give Tipsy 3 stars?  Well, after his shift ended the new bartender was much much better.  He explained that they were switching from winter to spring menu so that is why some things were out of date.  Noticed that the tap list was wrong, but knew exactly what he had in stock.  He was much more lighthearted and knew how to pour a beer.  Needless to say we stuck around for one more drink instead of slinking out as we were again having fun.  This experience just goes to show that good hires can make or break a place.  I will be giving this place another chance, just not with bartender #1.

Every time I've been to the tipsy cow I've enjoyed it, and I've been there... roughly 8-10 times. Why I keep going back: The food!!!!!  I initially went for it's decently priced fish fry which I think is the best in town, perhaps some of the best I've EVER had, and I've had many a fish fry over the years. Also... their curds are... oh.my. GOD. soooo good.   The truffle fries are unique and also good but I do somewhat feel like I gain a food baby after eating them - definitely a great thing to share!  The service is somewhat hit-or-miss, but it's never been terrible. It's always a place I suggest, oh and if you do go to the fish fry, prepare to wait awhile. but its worth it.

Okay concept, poorly executed.  Visited on a Thursday night around 8 p.m. My biggest grief with this place is that they served me a warm beer. A warm beer! When I called the waitress out on it, she said, "Well I don't know how that could have happened." She was nice enough to replace it at no cost but seriously.   The table next to us was full of tourists who all ordered Spotted Cows and the waitress said they were out. Really? You're a pub in downtown Madison called the Tipsy Cow and you're out of Madison's favorite beer?   My fiance liked his burger, I ordered a BLT which I figured would be hard to mess up. It wasn't spectacular. We also ordered the truffle fries, which were good, but it doesn't take a genius to serve French fries covered in truffle oil with a side of garlic aoli. Of course it's going to be good.  I expected a lot more out of the place and was disappointed. It will be awhile before we give it another try.

So very sad to say that after living in Madison for more than a few years that this was my first visit to The Tipsy Cow. I came here with my mom at about 1 PM on a Saturday and we were seated right away. I ordered a Bloody Mary which was really strong (in a good way) and I also appreciated that they asked me which vodka I would like in the drink. You don't always get that.   We had just left Fromagination and were already almost full so we decided to go with a few appetizers. We had the zucchini chips which came out piping hot and very crispy on the outside. I was seriously astonished that the zucchini stayed hot the entire time it was sitting at our table. We also got a special they had that day which was smoked salmon on top of 3 potato pancakes and topped with sour cream and chives. It was so freakin good. I will definitely be back to try some more of the food, and maybe some Monday night trivia!

Some of the best bar food in Madison. If you're looking for a place for drinks on a Friday or Saturday night , as well as some bar food, this is the place I would recommend you go. There are cheese curds are some of the best in Madison and the staff is very friendly!
Bartender on verge of being rude.  Very crowded.  Good beer selection and cozy environment but am not dying to go back.

Yum! Service was phenomenal.   We got the salmon grilled cheese special, which was delicious.   They didn't have the portobello sandwich, but we'll come back later to try that. I got the roasted veggie salad instead, which was much nicer than most places.   Overall, really yummy! Sandwiches were slightly greasy, but it was nice!
Not a lot of vegetarian options, and the service is pretty awkward, but the truffle fries are so worth it.
Been here several times now, food and service always great, and the selection of beers always interesting. A short walk from the Madison Concourse Hotel and a visit. Try the chili, i has a nice kick.
First impression was horrible. Sat down and had others sat after our party served with drinks and food before our order was even taken.

Four of us ate a late lunch at the Tipsy Cow after reading Yelp reviews, very disappointed.  Maybe you need to order specific food items but I cannot recommend eating here with so many other options in Madison.  We ordered the BBQ fries, BBQ sandwich, fish&chips, lamb burger.  I couldn't even eat the coleslaw that came with the fish chips, either it was spoiled or just old.   Everything we ordered was around $10 which I don't consider cheap for lunch but it's across the street from the capital so that must drive up prices.   If your looking for a beer this might be a good spot but for food there are other alternatives to check out.
Tipsy never disappoints. Good to great service.  Very friendly.  Excellent food - especially the burgers. (Harissa-feta, lamb)  And they allow dogs outside.    Thanks Tipsy.

Addicted to their apps! (Appdicted!?!?)  I love munching on their alligator bites and truffle fries *drool*...and the best part is that you can do full or half orders to mix and match. Their outside seating is the perfect chill spot to grab a drink with friends and enjoy the limited nice days in WI.
Great food! I loved the fried cheese curds and the wings! Everything was so delicious they also had a large selection of great beer. Would for sure go back.

Had a great experience there on a Saturday night. After putting our names on the wait list, my party of three walked up to the bar intending to get our drinks and stand. I don't know if it was just good karma, but the three seats that we were standing behind opened up before we had even ordered our drinks. After being told "cash or tab only" by the bartender we readily opened tabs, only to have the bartender immediately close them and bring the checks. That turned out okay though. We were quoted an hour, but hadn't finished our first drinks before we were texted that our table was ready.  We were led to a table in the bar just feet away from where we had been sitting previously. Our waiter was friendly, but didn't tell us his name. I ordered the Carnitas Fries appetizer for my meal and enjoyed it immensely. The pork was delicious and the spice level was just perfect. We did have to wait a bit for our waiter to come around with the checks, but I think we may have been the only table ordering food in the bar.

My family came here for dinner on a Thursday night.  Was a little surprised when we arrived about 6:30pm, not many people were in the place. It's a small place, so I thought that it would fill up quickly.  All I have to say is PBR battered  FISH TACOS!  They are AMAZING, it's one of their specials for Thursday night - you won't be disappointed. We also ordered several appetizers Goat Cheese Curds aka best thing you could ever fry, the alligator bites (meh),and  blue cheese and bacon fries (yummy!). My brother in law ordered the Tipsy burger, said that it was good but felt that the burgers from the Old Fashioned or Dotty's are better. Will definitely dine here again.

Came here for the wing special on Monday! Super good deal, half off of their normal wing price, so $6 for 12 or $12 for 24.  I went for the honey Harissa and the Parmesan peppercorn, two of my favorites. The honey harissa is super flavorful with a little bit of a kick, and I like to have a dry rub to mix things up.  Definitely fun to do this once every couple of weeks, can't wait to try out their other menu items as well! Oh, they also have trivia on Monday's it looks like. I ordered for take out but it seemed pretty packed

If I could put my review in a single sentence, I would have to say Tipsy Cow is good, but with reservations. Even at 1 pm in the middle of the week, TC was hopping. There is a strong smell of truffle oil in the air, so if you are not crazy about the pungent smell of truffle oil, you best avoid this place. Since I love truffle oil and use it in my own cooking, I was not put off by this. Most of the crowd at that time of day were co-workers having a late lunch out.  Tipsy has a bunch of daily specials that don't appear on the regular menu. I was intrigued by the chicken sandwich marinated in Moroccan spices. The sandwich was great, but it was very messy to eat with two hands. I must have run through about five napkins to wipe the sauce off my fingers. in hindsight, I should have given up and handled it with a knife and fork. Going back to the office lunch out folks, if the sandwich is that messy and sloppy , do you really want to eat it in front of your supervisor?  I didn't miss out on ordering a half order of truffle fries, which came with a mild mayo dipping sauce. Good thing I only ordered the half, as it was more than enough and I ended up taking most of my fries home with me.  Tipsy Cow has a great tap beer menu sketched out on the chalk board in each of the 'rooms' that make up the restaurant. Again, this is a place where you go with your office or get a beer or two at the bar by yourself.  One thing: If your good friends have told you or you yourself have discovered that you have a voice that can really carry in a small space, you may wish to tone it down, least you talk about something personal where every single word can be heard two or three tables away. Tipsy Cow was by no means quiet on the day I was there, but one person unwittingly made sure that everyone could hear every bit of her side of the conversation she was having.  The only door for entering and exiting is where the smokers like to congregate for a smoke and a chat. If you are sensitive to smoke, you might want to keep that in mind.

Tipsy cow has a chill city patio, nice staff and a solid vibe, however, the food was far less than impressive. Cheese curds were solid if you need a safe bet. For the main entree I went for the signature tipsy burger. I understand burgers are supposed to be hearty, but it was over the top greasy. Ended up to being a major gut bomb. My partner got the tequila chicken sandwich and the chicken was rubbery, an apparent clue that the meat being far from fresh. I ordered a simple drink and it was not on par. When something has two ingredients, it should be simple and balanced. I'd say Tipsy Cow is a great place to catch a good craft beer and chill out on the patio, and would limit it to that.

So the chalkboard in front of the tipsy cow said all New Glarus beer products three dollars. So I bought two spotted cows and the bill came to nine dollars. I said to the bartender hey what's up. He said those prices go into effect after 8 PM. But nowhere did it say that on the chalkboard. Talk about misleading.   Food was average...

Went back a second time...much better.  I also went back when it wasn't so busy (Saturday ~11:30).  I got the Grilled Chicken Sandwich.  It was cooked just right and the Zucchini Chips were really good (nice breading and crispy - tasty dipping sauce).

6/26/13 Stopped at the Tipsy Cow.  They always have a great tap beer selection.  It was 2 for 1 burgers.  I don't typically eat 2 burgers, but they were that good!  If you want fries you'll have to add them.  I enjoyed a nitro pour of the Left Hand Milk Stout.

A pretty good selection of beer, and I really like the atmosphere of this place. Clean, simple, and comfortable. I'm a huge fan of the outdoor patio on summer nights. The Tipsy Cow seems to specialize in classic American food; burgers, fries, beer and the like. It's not too bad for a drink on the weekend, but isn't worth your time if you can't get a table.   Above all else, come here for a burger. The thing that truly makes the Tipsy Burger stand out is the use of a Wisconsin 3-year cheddar in place of a standard slice of cheese. The sharpness is unmistakable. Coupled with a pretty excellent hunk of soft and juicy kobe-esque ground beef, this makes for one of the better and more memorable burgers that I have ever had. The special sauce certainly isn't bad either.

First time here, the food is really good. Busy with holiday shopping all evening, wanted a quick meal but not fast food. I love the aligator bites and you can never go wrong with the cheese curds. The burger was a lil on the greasy side but it was still delish. Was seated and served very quickly. Will definitely come again.

We tried The Tipsy Cow for lunch. It's a small place and the tables are pretty tightly put together. My knees were constantly hitting the chair near me and it was tight getting in and out. It's also very crowded. There was a line most of the time we were there.  The other slightly downside was that while I was at first impressed with the prices or the burgers and sandwiches, I was much less impressed when I realized that didn't include fries or chips. However, I was impressed with their appetizer and sides offerings.  I ended up ordering the Tipsy Burger and the cheese curds and I was very pleased. The burger is messy but delicious with two patties, bacon, and a "tipsy" sauce. I devoured it. The cheese curds were light and crispy tempura batter with gooey cheesy insides. Some of the best cheese curds I've had.   I'm looking forward to going back and trying more!

I chose the Tips for my birthday dinner. They have the best buffalo chicken sandwich in all of Madison. We had 7 people - got there at about 630 Saturday night. They told us 90 min but it was more like 60. But they took our # and we went down the street for a drink. I really liked that system. The hostess was very nice and had cool blue hair. Zucchini, French fry, and cheese curd apps were fantastic. I don't get excited over your average fried curds but there's are special. And the sandwich.... ugh I love that sandwich. I'd love to have a pretzel bun for an option. Nice tap list too, but no nitros. Our server was fantastic and even said someone dropped off like 30 cupcakes. She offered some to us and we had two. She remembered everybody's drinks from the first round - she was very impressive. It was a great time and I'll keep coming back for more! The only negatives are no nitros and the bathrooms are small and tend to have lines.

Very fitting name, as I've only ever been here tipsy.  It's right by the Capitol, so you know you're in a prime people-watching location. There's also a good chance that some kind of concert is happening right on King Street, so make sure to stop here and get your drink on before some tunes.  They have decent prices, a nice selection of beer (keep in mind my "nice" is different from everyone else's) and quick service.   I think I might make this my go-to get tipsy spot.   PS: I'm not an alcoholic; I just have a low tolerance for sobriety.

Went here when my girlfriend from Tucson came to visit. It was really good! We ate all of our food in 10 minutes (big portions, but it was so delicious!).  Best part: after all of our enjoyment, the check was not expensive at all! Definitely going back again and again!

I stopped in with a friend on Friday afternoon. The place has a nice atmosphere, but was a bit loud as the dining area was full.  A window view provided some people and surroundings viewing.   I had that Truffled Portabella Mushroom sandwich. It was very good. The bread was fried in butter which added flavor, but didn't take away from the mushrooms themselves. They have quiet the beer selection, of which I availed myself.   Overall a nice downtown dining experience.

Exactly what I expected from the name: a fun college town bar/restaurant. Friendly staff, good music, and good food. Unlike other establishments of this type, this place feels really clean with no musty holdovers of late drunken nights.

Sat at the bar, super-friendly bartenders.  Huge selection of beers and cocktails.  Food was amazing!  My recommendation is the tipsy burger.  Huge, fulfilling, delicious tipsy sauce and ooey-gooey!  French fries were crisp and delicious!  Tons of seating and the place was packed...no secret how great this place is!

Nice mellow atmosphere, laid back decor, and of course the chalk drawings from Monty Python and the Holy Grail.   Food is awesome (recommend the blue cheese and bacon fries) and haven't had a bad thing yet.   Good beer and food selection.
We came in with a Birthday Party.  Patrick, the Bartender couldn't be more rude.  Doubtful we'll go back.  Too bad such a great property couldn't offer more.

I had lunch here with my husband.  I'm a big fan on the re-branding.  Unlike another yelper, I LOVE the name.  But more importantly, great burger!  I got their simple cheeseburger - you can choose 1x1 up to 4x4, meaning the number of 1/4 lb patties and slices of cheese. I got 1x1 and especially loved the cheese - a nice aged cheddar.  Husband got the day's special - guac, bacon, pepper jack and jalapenos, and he loved his too.  We also split a basket of beer battered fries because they were half off.  Normally they'd be $8 which is a lot for fries, but they are a huge portion - so $4 for that many fries seemed like a fine deal.  They were a great texture, perfectly cooked. Next time I'll try the truffle/garcli aioli fries though.  And lastly, great service! Plenty of water refills, timely service and just the right amount of attention.  And with fans and high ceilings, the climate was comfortable - so apparently they fixed whatever temperature problems was happening earlier in the summer.

Stopped by this past Monday to get an order of the carnita fries, yet again, and they were even more amazing than last time. The pork carnitas were so juicy and tender. They reminded me of pork carnitas from authentic mexican restaurants back home in Chicago. Tipsy is definitely doing something right!
Fun spot in Madison! Great location, good specials (even on a Saturday night!), friendly staff, and GOAT cheese curds!!! Get them. You're welcome.

The Tipsy Cow is all and more that a Wisconsin-influenced Madison bar can be.  They make sure that all the staples of a Wisconsin bar are at par excellence.  The place has limited seating, but does have a fairly large bar.  As with all great institutions, it is generally quite busy.  But I assure you that the wait is worth it.     When I last went I had the pleasure of eating the Tipsy Burger.  It has to be the best burger I've had in the midwest.  The tipsy sauce and the cheeses pair together so well with the light grease on the burger and onions.  The cheese curds are also some of my favorite in Madison.  They definitely make the top three out of all the cheese curds I've had in Madison (well over 15 variations of curds).  The fish fry is also one of the best, having won best fish fry in Wisconsin before.  The fish is of some of the highest quality, and the breading is second to few.    The bar has quite a few beers on tap, it's no hopcat, but the food is actually good here.  The bartenders seem to be very knowledgeable, and the brandy old-fashioned sweets hit the nail on the head.
