The bartenders and servers were altogether hospitable and ready to please.    Overall you cannot go wrong with The Tipsy Cow.  It's a Madison institution that does everything to perfection.

Something different!  The menu is not large but is creative.  Many of the items are fresh and in season, with a focus on traditional items made with local, artisan products. This means GOOD Wisconsin cheese, tasty Wisco meats and fresh local veggies.  I have had the truffle fries, the grilled cheese, the cheeseburger and a special sandwich that had a kimchi-esque veggie topping.  The servers is decent, casual and not pushy.  The space is cute, open with lots of windows. Great location right on the square. The bar area is large and welcoming.  I love to visit this place when back in Madison.
Not impressed.  Service was slow. Food was boring bar food.  Decent beer selection.

To be honest, I stopped by this place to grab a beer and cheese curds while I waited for a table at Graze. Although the Tipsy Cow was very crowded, we were still able to get a seat at a corner table for two. We were expecting a 45 minute wait to be seated at Graze, but we were called back within 20 minutes. Lucky for us, we had our beer, cheese curds and salad served about 10 minutes after we placed our order! Our server was amazing! It probably took an additional 10 minutes to eat our food and receive our check. Talk about a dine-n-dash!
Nice staff. Kinda boring atmosphere. We didn't stay long. Food was good.

I rounded up from a 3.5, very good bar food, great beer selection and a knowledgeable bartending crew.  Had two things off the special menu, though it seems the pork shoulder sandwich with Tipsy Q sauce is on there a lot, pretty awesome with the slaw on top.  Big portions, very tasty, cheap.  I didn't miss the fries on the side, but the one thing we didn't realize was that everything is a la carte, no sides.  No big deal, but for first timers, if you're feeling like some deep fried yumminess on the side, order it from their very extensive and creative starters menu.  Expect a lengthy wait on a weekend night, but that's just Madison.  We'll be back!

LOVE this place.   Not only are the drinks cheap, they're good and the vibes are even better. Granted the hostess might be a little off in her time estimates (she quoted a 90 minute wait and then called us back in 15) but who cares! Grab your friends order the Tipsy burger with a beer and some cheese curds and you are set!   1. The burger-- juicy Cheesy melty goodness with fried onions. Please... just say yum   2. Cheese curds-- arguably the best in Madison and I will have to agree. My dilemma is between here, the old fashion, and graze...but the ranch is so great here... just yum   $3 jamo shots on fridays ... nuff said. You're good to go   Happy eating!

It's really loud in there but for goat cheese curds, I will do almost anything.  Cheap drinks, cheap food, great time. Coming from Chicago, you'd be hard pressed to spend less than $10 on a great meal, which is what happened here. I split the goat cheese curds with a friend, and ordered 6 wings, and it was the perfect amount of food.  The honey harissa sauce for the wings gets a special shoutout because it was amazing. If you want spicy, savory, and a hint of sweet, go for this sauce. I was full by the 5th wing but just *had* to eat that 6th one for the sauce.  Bonus that they were playing the Cubs game on all of the TVs!

We stopped in on a whim and ate outside on a beautiful Friday night.  The wait staff was friendly and attentive.  I had the Spicy Steak Sandwich and my 13 year old had the Lamb Burger-both were excellent!  We shared an order of Sour Cream and Onion fries which were addicting.  Didn't even step inside, so I can't attest to that, but food was excellent and beverage choices were plentiful.
Good bar service but their food is very greasy and the place is too crowded for my taste. I would not go there again.
I'm visiting from out of town but you can't go wrong with their cheese curds and tipsy burgers.
Very average. A bit disappointed since it was reviewed so high. Tipsy Burger was way too sloppy. Good outdoor eating area.

Soggy greasy meh fish fry. Cole slaw was good. Fries were pretty blah too. Over all disappointed with service and food. Atmosphere is beautiful and they have an amazing beer selection. I was surprised by how nasty the fish was.

Bar food? Nah, much more upscale and delicious than that! Husband had the asparagus and egg sandwich. Yep, sounded gross to me too. He said it was fantastic. I had to take a bite and indeed, it was! I had the ham and cheese sandwich. Very light, not greasy and delicious. Apps were fried cheese curds ( need I say more on this?) and carnitas fries. Heaven on a platter!  Service was great and prompt, location was fantastic too! A must for a casual lunch in Madison!

I ate here last Wednesday, and it was as good as always. I had the House Roasted Turkey sandwich. It was great, and had a spicy mustard kick to it. The time prior, I had the Tipsy Burger, which was really good. I've eaten here a handful of times and have always liked the food.  They also have plenty of beer, and the bartenders/servers are always really good at what they do. I feel like the prices are decent for the quality of food you get.  A great choice if you are hanging out downtown.

We stopped in twice this week (once for a drink and once for food). This review is for the full dining experience.  Atmosphere is great. Inside was packed and we ended up being sat on the patio on a perfect fall evening.   Service was slowww. I mean the actual server took forever to stop by, beer rounds were hard to come by, etc. Food also took forever. Don't come here if you are in any sort of rush or if you just dislike slow service in general.  Food was okay but nothing great. I'd be okay eating here again but it would t be my first choice.   Overall just a meh place. Don't love it, don't hate it, just average.

Stopped here because it looked inviting with outside tables even tho we ate inside. Glacamole, bacon burger was great along with the generous serving of truffle fries and fried cheese curds. The sides were half orders. Service was excellent. A little on the noisy side even late Sat. afternoon when it wasnt real busy  Would definitely return.

The Tipsy Cow is a restaurant with a packed bar in Madison serving up traditional Wisconsin pub fare, and offers a few vegetarian items on their menu. It was quite busy for a gloomy, rainy Friday night. My close friend and I were up in Madison visiting another friend, and ended up getting dinner with a few of his friends. I was enroute to a wedding in Wisconsin Dells, but figured I could spend the night hanging out in Madison.  The wait was about 30 minutes, and once we ordered, it took about 40 minutes to get our food. I ordered the tomato soup, the house salad, and the portobello sandwich.  The soup was a thicker bisque that comes with cheese curds floating around inside. The cheese curds were a fun addition, but the soup tasted a bit Chef Boyardee like to me. And it was a very intense taste, more like a sauce than a soup. I ate it all, of course, fueled by the desire to consume as much delicious cheese in Wisconsin as possible. The house salad was kind of odd: the greens were super chopped up, as if the greens were meant to be a topping for something else. The salad was also topped with radishes and chunks of tomato. One of my friends ended up eating most of the salad. The sandwich was small, but it had a good combination of cheese, vegetables, and portobello on it.  My friend ordered a grilled cheese, which came with some ridiculous sauce between the layers of cheese. It was quite surprising to take a bite and see the sauce squirt out. She ended up letting me eat it with my tomato soup, which was kind of her.  Overall, the visit to The Tipsy Cow was fun, but as a restaurant, it is not on the same level as The Great Dane, and not even close to The Old Fashioned.

On a busy Wednesday evening.  We watched as our drinks sat at the bar with our server clearly overwhelmed and often nowhere to be found. After waiting for our appetizers for over 20 minutes,  we asked another server where they might be. She apologized and informed us that our server was "new". Suddenly our appetizers appeared. The truffle fries were tasty, but clearly had been sitting for awhile before making their way to our table. When our entrees arrived,  I realized that the salad  I received, albeit tasty,  was not the salad I ordered.  Our server was apologetic and we asked for a to go box and the bill and waited another 10+ minutes before we saw her again.   The food was good and service, while friendly, was lacking.

Goat cheese curds- 4 out of 5 moos Cheese curds were tasty. Didn't really notice a difference with the goat cheese, but they seemed less squeaky.   Alligator bites- 3 out of 5 moos First time trying alligator!  Tasted just like chicken. I think the buffalo and breaking took away from the alligator meat.   Guacamole bacon burger- 3 out of 5 moos Delicious guac, thick bacon, delicious burger. Wish there was more meat. I was able to substitute for goat cheese, definitely would recommend this cheese swap!  Only thing that is tipping this review from a 5 to a 4 is the service. Wait times to be seated and receive water were super slow. The waitstaff seemed very flustered.

$3 craft beer specials - what planet am I on?! I'm coming in from Chicago, where a craft beer STARTS at $6, and if you really want a $20 beer there is probably one on the menu.  So yeah, I'm really pleased with the Madison restaurant scene :D Tipsy Cow is no exception. I had the fried walleye sandwhich, and it was done up perfectly. There was some kind of spicy mayo and slaw on it, so there was some tanginess to balance out the savory fish fry flavor.  I had a hot pretzel as my side (?!) and it was great, would be the perfect compliment to a beer and burger combo.  Onion rings were a bit much for me, they are huge and hugely breaded. But whiffing on one side is no big deal, the pretzels were great :)

Great cheese curds. Definitely recommend the goat cheese curds. They are super creamy with a sweet flavor and not an intense breading. Also super great tap lineup. Nice patio view of the city as well, weather permitting.

Spring in madison means outdoor seating at tipsy cow! I stopped by for a snack and beer. They have a great selection of beer, and their CHEESE CURDS YESSSS! Don't know what they do with their batter for their curds, but definitely one of my faves in madison! I'll definitely need to be back to have a full meal!

AMAZING! We stopped here passing through town as tourists, not expecting such an incredible meal. The entire restaurant has a great vibe, delicious food, tasty drinks, and wonderful service. We will definitely stop by again next time we're in Madison!

Like i said before which was removed ,sadly.   If you enjoy a good bar fight with a bunch of drunk roofers then The Tipsy Cow should be your destination of choice !! The owners have no control over their patrons which usually end up yelling, screaming and fighting every Friday and Saturday night up and down Main Street !!.....What Else Can I Say "Flies Are Attracted To Shit" !!

"The Tipsy Burger"--tastiest burger in Town.   The only burger that ever made me pause to take the Lord's name in vain and exclaim, "God %#@, that's a tasty burger!"  Since then--over 7 years ago--I have been on a fruitless (but fun) quest to find one I like better.  I've had them in bowling alleys, bars (ie, Oakcrest, Blue Moon), chains (Five Guys, Fuddruckers, etc), and higher end (ie, Graze). None have dethroned The TB.  My quest continues.  Suggestions?  Ps--along with a Tipsy Burger, I strongly recommend a side order of their truffle fries and housemade pickles.     Pps--2nd place so far?  The brat/burger at Country Corners Bar out past Yahara Golf Course.  Greasy guilty burger brat heaven with hot salty fries (and fermented malt beverages on tap!) in a friendly spacious and accessible country bar.

Decent beer and food...rude indifferent staff. When the wait staff decides that THEY are more important than the patrons it is time to clean house.  If you can get a seat in the tipsy (which is rare) be prepared to be the object of disdain from the wait staff that has decided that their tips are more important than their service.  We all have been in crowded bars before, but when the staff decides that saying "excuse me" is no longer necessary it is time to send them packing to Buffalo Wild Wings or Quaker Steak & Lube where they undoubtably came from.  I was bumped repeatedly by the staff as I tried to drink a beer - twice hard enough to cause me to spill my drink... With not as much as a "I'm sorry".  The bartenders are nice however.  They do need to figure out that overly hopped beers are not necessarily good beers.

We been here three times over the last year, bringing family or friends who are visiting. The food is good and the location and restaurant is cool.  The downside is that each time we've been there we've noticed that service has been consistently slow.  The last visit my husband had to get up and corner our waiter to see the bill and hand him our card.    It's probably not our last time there as a couple but we probably will choose other places to take guests.

I was a little disappointed with the Tipsy Cow, The food left me saying meh and not wow! Although the cheese curds are at a very high bar, That couldn't convince me to add a fourth star, Overall a great place for beer and bar chow!

Seven out of ten stars. I go here a lot to be outside on the deck, and there is often open seats (that should tell you something). I struggle with a large menu of things I don't want to order, and watch a lot of folks getting a burger in desperation. Great draft beer selection if you love hops, otherwise many bottles. Good staple on the square.

Solid place for a burger and a beer. Since I'm a Chicagoan, Spotted Cow on tap for $4 gives it an automatic 4 stars for me.   Cheese Curds: Less greasy than Old Fashioned's curds.  Solid, not memorable.  Burger $6: Quarter pound ("1x1") was well done and juicy. Comes with fried onions and cheddar. I had had cheese curds so a 1x1 was enough for me.  I would go back.

Great scratch made food.. awesome beer selection as well. Visiting the area and came here after the first place we tried was very limited menu. Tipsy cow has great selection. Order onion rings and that was meal by itself super fresh and huge.. then I did the tipsy burger is sooo good.. large and great flavor. The pickle were the key. Pickles are house made and by far the best ever!! Highly recommend this place..

We came here because my husband saw a review on a burger blog about their burger. We were visiting friends in Madison and came for lunch.  It was definitely not too crowded on a Friday afternoon which was nice. We were able to hang out and catch up without feeling rushed. I can't speak to weekends or dinner time.  We both ordered the tipsy burger. It was juicy, cooked as asked (medium) and also HUGE. It was a double and I'm not used to eating that much so it was definitely filling. But we got it cuz that's what the burger blog said was great and it wasn't lying! It came with a side of our choice so we naturally got the fried cheese curds. The curds were perfectly fried with not too much batter and thus preserving the squeakiness of the cheese. Yum. The curds did not disappoint. I have to say they were the highlight but the burger was also really good.  There was a good selection of beers on tap. The servers were friendly and the place was chill. A great lunch spot with super yummy cheese curds and good burgers!

Monty Python chalk drawings won me over right away!  The beer was great and the sever seemed to be knowledgable in the different beverages available.  We ordered the curds since we heard they were delicious, and they were impressive.  Maybe not the best in Madison but in the top 5.    The burger was delightfully greasy and the fries were yummy as well.  Definitely a fun place to hang out!

I would consider myself a regular at the Tipsy Cow, both as a restaurant and a bar. Their beer list is out of this world. Their food list is consistently great - I have tried over half the menu and have yet to be disappointed. The waitstaff can be great, mediocre, or terrible - I've had all three types - but at least they're usually friendly. The bartenders are always phenomenal as humans as well as with recommendations. They really seem like the kind of guys who bond with their customers, reward their regulars by remembering their drinks, and are just overall nice people. Only negative? PLEASE fix the A/C! It's so hot I think I'm going to pass out sometimes.

Interesting menu and always a good atmosphere with plenty of energy.  You may experience some confusion at the hostess stand which is no big deal if you expect it. Good beer list while you wait and the ala carte sandwiches are good.

I had a smoked salmon grilled cheese and my boyfriend had the tipsy burger. The salmon must have not been handled properly. I ended up throwing up everything on the way back, almost fainted cause I was so sick! My boyfriend who only had a couple bite also got sick later that night. We were both in and out of bathroom all night. Very disappointed! NOT going back.

Went back to TC before dinner at Bellini and ordered a Tipsy Rita and Spotted Cow along with the Spinach and Artichoke Dip and tortilla chips. Drinks were good, holy moly the dip had a real kick to it. Place was half full and bartender kept us in good shape while we were there. Wanted to order cheese curds as they're awesome here but my better half wanted the dip.   Next time I'm getting cheese curds.

Great atmosphere. Had the sour cream and onion fries that the bartender recommended and they were great! Also had an order of the onion rings which were beer battered and thick. Also very good. Would definitely go back for dinner.sometime soon.

Food was good.  Waitress was maybe busy?  She wasn't around our table much.  One of the kids ordered a grilled cheese with bacon, but the bacon was missing.  Everyone else was pretty happy with their food.  Normally we have a really good experience here, but tonight was definitely off.  I can't even compose a proper review, so I'll just stop here.

I thought it is an excellent location at the capitol. And such a catchy name, always worths a shot to try.   I had a lamb burger with onion rings. I thought, oh my? How could my burger be so wet and drippy ? It was to the point of disgusting me especially towards the end of me biting on it. Onion rings, was massive, and they came out great though. The price was really a bargain, but do I want another soaked burger ? I don't think so unfortunately.

This place gets 4 stars as one of the best cheese curd places in Madison. Try the goat cheese especially!  The Tipsy Burger and Truffle Fries were incredibly underwelming, however. I was told that this was the best burger place in Madison and it couldn't hold a candle to numerous other Madison burger establishments.  Think I'll stick with the cheese curds.

Service was great, we got seated quickly despite the crowd. Beer selection is pretty good. Naturally, we ordered Spotted Cow. Also got a mixed drink, which was made well. Started off with Korean beef fries - 4 stars. Really good. Would've been 5 stars if there was more beef on the fries. For entree my fiancée and I both ordered chicken sandwiches and this is where the 2 stars come in. I would bet good money that our chicken patties were frozen. And if they're not frozen, then they should consider new cooks because it's not difficult whatsoever to cook chicken. Not to mention the chicken was a proper serving size for a child, not an adult. Maybe 2.5oz. It was rubbery and thin. Just like the frozen patties you can get at the store! I paid $9 for $3.50 sandwich. Overall, I wouldn't return.

I think this place is great. Good beer specials, comfortable place to lounge near other bars and the square, and most importantly--great junk food. Seriously, the cheese fries here are the best cheese fries (cheese sauce, not melted cheddar) I've ever had. At $7 for a medium-small serving they'd better be, but they were. Burgers are your run-of-the-mill good burgers, thin and greasy, and you order them stacked. $5 for one patty is far too expensive, but $11 for a quadruple burger seems about right since it's about 300 grams of delicious fat in one serving. This place isn't as nice as the Old Fashioned or Graze, but if you're just looking for some real Wisconsin grub and a beer, The Cow is more casual and just as good if not better.  PS -- I've heard complaints about their lack of vegetarian options. They should totally just add a texas toast grilled cheese to the menu or something.
Stopped here after checking into my hotel for a quick bite and a beer. Service was super fast, food was good and prices very reasonable. Check out the New Glarus Spotted Cow.

Greasy Spoon!  Based on Yelp reviews we went for lunch.  We had the grilled chicken sandwich, a bacon cheeseburger and onion rings.  All of it was waaaay greasy.  The onion rings were the worst for grease.  There were extra napkins at the table.  It was good, because they were needed to wipe away the grease.  The buns on both the burger and the chicken sandwich were soggy.  We don't drink beer.  Maybe that's the attraction here.  For food...not a good choice.

My husband and I really did not enjoy this restaurant and it takes a lot for us to not enjoy food as we are not picky. I think my biggest complaint about the restaurant is how close they put the 2 seat tables together. There was maybe half a foot between each so you couldn't have a conversation with the person you were with as everyone around you could easily hear your conversation. Our server took a while to bring us the food and then disappeared for a while and all those around us who came later received their checks and left before we did (they all had different servers). We also both ordered items with buffalo and both were so hot we couldn't even eat them. We normally like buffalo food but this was so hot that we could barely take a bite without having to take a drink of water. I will say that the drink selection was good and they had some good beers on tap. Other than that we were not too impressed.
Both the goat cheese and regular curds were good. Service is really slow. I had the green salad and it made me sick. It was not cold at all, I think the lettuce had been out all day. Went on 7/16/16

Cheap prices for high quality food and cocktails!! truffle fries were on point and the goat cheese curds are worth the up grade. Asparagus and egg sandwich was really good and the I like how the artichoke dip came with veggies to dip. Cool open atmosphere right on the street. I would definitely recommend and go back.

I like going to the Tipsy Cow on occasion, and it's for a few reasons:  1. The appetizer selection is deep-fried delicious in my tummy. They serve a lot of the standard fare (onion rings, fries, etc.), but they also offer a few unique items. Some of these include the Zucchini Chips, and the Goat Cheese curds, both of which I thought tasted great. On top of that, you can order numerous variations of the french fries, as you can get a lot of different sauce/topping combinations like buffalo/blue cheese, bbq/ranch, sour cream/onion, and garlic aioli.  2. Despite the name, it manages to be vegetarian friendly. It's not as good as say The Green Owl or Ha Long Bay, but there's a few vegetarian sandwiches, and a couple good salads to select from.  3. The tap selection rotates frequently, and is usually a stellar ensemble cast. It's mostly Wisconsin brews, but it adds in a few welcome guests as well.  4. The avocado tacos on Thursdays are to die for! They're easy to eat, packed with flavor, and filling.  All of this makes the Tipsy Cow a good place to spend an evening, but it could use a couple tune ups to be really great. Some of the sandwiches I have had could have tasted better, the appetizer selection could use 1 or 2 healthier choices, and the taps could have a bit of a larger selection (although the tap selection changing a lot does help make up for this). Maybe i'm just being picky though. I do know however that the Tipsy does some things really well, so sticking to those is a sure bet when you visit.

We went to the Tipsy Cow last night and got there at about 6:15. Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table which was fine. About 15 minutes after we were seated we looked up and the place was packed.   I was hungry so I ordered the Tipsy Burger and the bacon and blue cheese fries.  The burger was juicy and delicious. The fries were also very tasty. We also ordered the Tipsy chicken sandwich which was a bit  dry. I wouldn't order that again.   I like this restaurant and will go back. The food is good and they have a nice beer selection.

Came in on a Friday night around 6:30pm on the recommendation of someone I got to chatting to while bottling wine the other week.  I was told that they had 18 beers on tap, and full pints (20oz, not the reduced size they're pushing downtown these days) were always on for $6, so I was sold!  The place was close to half full already - a good sign that early in the night, though a Raptors game was coming on later.  The staff were great, and I was pleasantly surprised to see one of my fav (but hard to find) drafts on tap - Kronenbourg Blanc!    Food-wise, I had the nachos and they were quite nice - and probably one of the best layered I've ever had (chips underneath weren't bare).  Price/value-wise, definitely a good deal.  Only exception - $3 for fruit juice - that seemed steep.  They also don't have a kids' menu but were able to strip down the chicken poutine to just a standard poutine (and charged less), which was quite nice.  They also apparently plan on having a kids' menu at some point.  The guy who chatted with us (dang, forget his name - he's a songwriter that's all I remember) was awesome - giving us some background on the place and about future plans.  Apparently the owner also owns pubs (Firkins) in Toronto as well, and it shows in the high quality of the setup and food here.  Only other negative - the tables are new but don't really match the other bar decor - wooden pub-style ones would match better and feel more appropriate than the current light-coloured tables.  See the pictures someone else uploaded to see what I'm talking about.  They told us they've had the same thoughts and are still thinking about these as well.  OK that all said, this place has definitely 5 star potential - minor hiccups in the decor and pricing notwithstanding, I'm going to be back here soon and hope to upgrade this to a 5 star.  Even in its current state though, best pub in town!

So, came to the Tipsy Cow at about 1:30 ish pm. Restaurant looked full, but we were sat within 5 minutes. Waiter came and took our food order, and that was it. Didn't see him again for another 30 minutes. No check in or telling us our food was delayed. We had to flag down a different waitress to see what the hold up was. Our original Waiter came back and offered some lame excuse, and said our food was "coming right out". Waited another 5-10 minites before it finally came.  We waited 45 minutes total for our food. People who were sat AFTER us got their food before we did. That seems to be a bit ridiculous considering we were a party of three, and we were ordering bar food.   When the food finally arrived, it was decent. Beer battered fries were good. Chicken sandwich was kinda meh. I had ordered it crispy, but it came grilled. Kinda dry and flavorless. Still ate it though because I was so effin' hungry from waiting so damn long.   Either there were issues in the kitchen or our waiter just completely forgot about us. It didn't seem like they were short staffed because there was plenty of wait staff around. Either way, they did comp half our meal so that was nice. Honestly I would be more forgiving and probably wouldn't be writing a review had the waiter checked in with us on a regular basis.
we had a big group in for a wedding brunch a couple of weeks ago the wait staff are awesome super friendly and accommodating the food is good I would recommend to anyone
Was recommended by an Epic training instructor. We went there to try the cheese curds. It was excellent.

i Basked in the flavors of the Tipsy burger. Filled my craving to the max for a burger. The bloody was bland and watery. But the bartender was attentive and friendly to all the customers. Great tap list too. Will sure be back to try some fries that looked awesome but too big of a serving for this girl by her self this time.
Fun place! And good, cheap menu.

Mostly the experience ruined this place for us. Got seated just inside on the left next to the women's bathroom door. The door SLAMMED constantly through the entire meal. This area is also right next to the bar where the bartenders are clanking glasses and doing dishes. Had a raging headache by the time I left. As for the food, I'd give it a 3/5. Cheese curds 5/5, terrific! Bacon/avocado burger was good, but bacon tasted like pre cooked Oscar Meyer bacon and the fries resembled the deep-fried, belly burners I used to get at the Iowa state fair. Probably won't go back.

The Tipsy is not generally a bad bar; in fact usually it's great. However, there have been some serious problems when they run Trivia on Mondays, that may reveal bigger problems with their hosting practices. Simply put, they cannot manage table allocation when they're busy, and they do not put fairness or efficiency high on their list for seating.  Our team went every Monday night for months, becoming familiar faces in the process. But as trivia became more popular, we had to show up earlier and earlier to ensure we'd get a table. This is in part due to Tipsy's policy that at least half of a party must be present to be seated -- and worse, that they can't even put their names on a list until that point.  Pretty soon we were coming close to an hour ahead of time, and we'd often wait most or all of it. We were usually a big party, and as such we tried to be predictable, patient and compliant, but too often we were told tables couldn't be put together, or were forgotten about, or we watched as multiple smaller parties would be ushered in ahead of us, all with curt, inattentive service from the hosts.  Finally, on a particular night when the whole gang was there a full hour ahead of time, we immediately indicated we wanted a table. We waited for 45 minutes as we occasionally checked in with half-aware staff distributing long-empty tables, then were told there was a table opening up that we could get in 5-10 minutes. Scouting revealed the party in question had finished their food and signed their check some time ago, and were just sitting chatting. After 15 minutes had gone by, we asked whether the hostess might politely mention to them that others were waiting to be seated, but she laughingly informed us that wasn't possible. 10 minutes after that, we asked again what the status was, and the hostess blithely informed us that we'd actually been second on the list, and that OUR table would be opening up shortly -- it would probably be another 5-10 minutes.  We left, and have not gone back for trivia. However, even without considering that we were regular customers, their behavior seemed so rude and cavalier that many of us have developed pretty negative feelings about them. After all, it was really the culmination of a string of problems, not an isolated incident; and we felt they could have managed not just more efficiently, but more sympathetically.  To some this might sound whiny, but as a former server myself at a similar establishment, I just couldn't believe how little weight they seemed to be giving customer experience. Maybe they thought as long as they were busy, they didn't have to care.

Had lunch here with some friends a few weeks ago. The food was excellent, service was decent, prices are okay. I had a burger and our group shared the Korean BBQ fries and alligator bites. Korean BBQ fries were okay; just fries with spicy mayo and some bulgogi, probably won't order that again. But the alligator bites! The alligator bites were SO good and I wish I could eat those every day! The burger I had was also excellent. I got the lamb burger topped with a fried egg and it was just perfect!  We sat outside because it was such a nice day, but I feel like because we were outside our server didn't come to check on us very often. We all ran out of water and had to flag down another server after waiting for quite a while. Aside from that, service was friendly and quick so I would definitely come back!

Traveling through looking for authentic WI cheese curds and read a couple of reviews on this place. We were not disappointed with the cheese curds, they were great! The place was packed for happy hour we are assuming. They had a variety of beers and on Thursdays you get $1 off tap beers! We had the grilled ham and cheese, BLT, fries, tomato soup, and tequila chicken salad. The grilled ham and cheese was cheesy, but maybe too cheesy for my taste(right! In WI something was too cheesy!). It had good flavor, but it was overwhelming. I didn't care for the tomato soup. It was very sweet and thick, and left a strange aftertaste in my mouth. BLT was tasty, great bacon! The fries were incredible. The salad was decent, but the chipotle dressing wasn't my favorite.
Great butter chicken and naan. Even better with pint of Muskoka Detour. Service is excellent.

Last night was my first time at the Tipsy Cow. We went for my boyfriend's birthday. We had a very enjoyable time. The food was great. I had a traditional cheeseburger and a half order of truffle fries. For an appetizer we shared the cheese curds. I think they were the best cheese curds I ever had. They melted in my mouth.   I gave the business 4 out of 5 stars for two reasons. First, I informed the staff that it was my boyfriend's birthday and they didn't do anything for it. No dessert or free beer. I wish they would have made it more special for him. Second, the server did not clear the cheese curd basket away until after we finished eating our main meal. The table was super small and it would have been nice to have the extra space but that wasn't a major deal.   I would go back but not to celebrate a birthday.

Oh Tipsy Cow.  I love you.  I have eaten here several times and I have never been disappointed.  It is a comfortable restaurant with decently priced food.  They have simple burgers and more dressed up burgers.  I have been a fan of their beer-battered fries and cheese curds for quite some time.  Then, my world changed.  I tried their truffle fries.  Yes, you just read that.  TRUFFLE tries.  Wow.  $8 you say?  Well worth it.  Share with a friend.  You get what you pay for and that is amazingness.    They have great service.  I went to their booth at the Taste of Madison and the line moved fast.  They were so friendly even though they were slammed.  They are always friendly.  Oh Tipsy Cow, I love you.  My only Tipsy complaint?  I hate sharp cheddar and that is their standard cheese.  I know there are a few others but I am not a big fan of their cheese assortment.  Please add mild cheddar for people out there like me.

This is my all time favorite place to get Cheese curds! So amazing as it's tender, cheesy, and crispy and they provide some delicious ranch to go with them. The service was fair as I knew they were busy  but their other foods are delicious. We got some alligator bites too which is unique to get here in Madison

On a whim I decided to stop in because if the name. "The Tipsy Cow" in Madison Wisconsin is a classic name. It is a great little place to stop for a beer with their large selection of bottles and daily draught specials and an incredible menu of burgers, sandwiches and appetizers. The service was pretty good too which made this an excellent experience.

Yum! I happened to stop here before doing some pre-great taste drinking and I am so glad. The burger was fantastic! I can't remember the name of it, but the combination of cheeses and sauce and bacon and beef was something bordering on magical. I also highly recommend the cheese curds. It was my top choice for them for sure! Wish I could have stayed longer to sample a few more beers and bites!

Best burger EVER! Super juicy but not greasy, thick cut bacon that was actually not flabby, and the Tipsy sauce! Only issue was the waitress... She actually admitted that she forgot about us. It was a Monday, so the C team must have been in play.
The Truffled Portabella Mushroom Sandwich totally blew me away! We walked into this place because we couldn't get a seat in another restaurant. Once we got our food we're glad we came here instead.

I stopped here for lunch by myself on a Friday afternoon, at about 11:45. It's pretty small inside - I was seated right away, but it looked as though there were several groups waiting to be seated as I neared the end of my visit at 12:15.  Service was fine, not outstanding but not terrible. Again, I was seated by myself so others may have had a different experience.   The food itself was average. I had the fish fry - the fish was great, but it was a smaller portion than I expected for the price. The bread and coleslaw tasted as expected, and the fries were good (although under the fish, so some pieces got soggy).   My overall experience was good. I'd come back again, perhaps with a group of friend to see if the dining experience changes. It looks like a great place to grab a drink!

This review is mainly for the Trivia on Monday night. We arrived around 7:30 for 8 trivia, and luckily were able to get 3 seats at the bar, since the place was packed otherwise. The trivia was a lot of fun, spanned a lot of categories, and gave us all good conversation starters.   We shared the spinach and artichoke dip, which was below average. There wasn't really any artichoke in it, and it was just overpoweringly cheesy and creamy (which doesn't sound bad, but it really wasn't a good dip). It came with an abundance of veggies and chips to dip in it though, which was nice that they didn't limit that.   Would definitely return and order a different appetizer, or order a full meal.

Highlight: If you're like me and you're a lactose intolerant cheese lover, then head on down to the Tipsy Cow and order the goat cheese curds! You can enjoy Cheese Curds without the dreadful after effects.   Overall, I'm ALWAYS satisfied at the TC. I was weary of their shrimp salad (coz true bar food can be suspect, sometimes) and it exceeded my expectations. Also, they've got homemade cookies that are novel and irresistible. :D   Trivia night is SUCH FUN. Definitely would recommend trying it out. I suck at trivia, and still had a blast, haha

The Good: Ate at Tipsy Cow with some out of town guests. We were all very happy with our meal. I ordered a salad to balance the cheese curds-the meal was delicious and the service was efficient.   The Not So Good: Unfortunately, we had a very long wait for our table. This would not have been the end of the world but there was nowhere really to stand and wait. I alternated between being shoved around for a bit and standing by the cold door.   Highlight: The regular cheese curds. The best I have had in Madison!

Super cute place in Mad-town.  We were bar hopping and came across this place and decided to stop in for some drinks and appetizer before going to dinner at The Old Fashioned.   We were fairly early, before 6pm, so it was pretty empty.  Plus, school was out so the whole town was rather quiet.  It worked out well though because we were able to get seats right at the bar, no problem.  Okay, so this was my first time getting Alligator Bites.  Yes, I ate alligator.  And strangely, it tasted like chicken.  It was actually really good!  The bartender recommended it so we went for it.  Delicious!  And of course, Cheese Curds.  Yes, more cheese curds.  I liked the curds here.  Not sure I would say they were the best ever, but it was good!

I came here based on the glowing reviews. But really, it's was quite the disappointment.  We were seated instantly, but our server took forever to greet us, let alone, give us water or the drinks we ordered.  The burgers we received were below average. Thinking that it would be wise to get the burger named after the restaurant (tipsy burger) upon its arrival the bread was soft and soggy. Overall not very well together. I would say that this was a mess of a "restaurant". It should just be called a bar & charge bar prices for these burgers because I do not feel this was more than a three dollar burger.
Just another fantastic meal at Tipsy. This time it is the wings with Spicy Asian sauce.  Delicious.  Service is great as always.  Nice tap selection. James for $3....very nice.

Great! I have sat down to eat at Tipsy Cow multiple times now. Always very pleased with the food and service. I have ordered everything from their original Tipsy burger to fish tacos. The food is always presented ina fashionable manner. They make everything look good enough to eat! All I can say is truffle fries!!!!!! In the mood for cheese curds, well i have found the place for you to get them!!!!! The cheese selection for their burgers was untouchable by other food joints around the capital. Tipsy cow is great! Enough said.

I came here for lunch and didn't have high expectations because it just seemed like a typical bar restaurant.  But, the grilled cheese with bacon was AMAZING.  OMG, it was perfectly tangy, generous cheddar cheese, and they slabbed some creamy sauce on it that melted into the perfect consistency- melty, gooey, and delicious on a crispy thick multigrain bread.  We also got their fried cheese curds which were good too, they tasted like little pieces of fried mozzarella sticks but more chewier and fresh.    I wish I could come back to eat the grilled cheese...for dinner, lunch, breakfast, again and again!

I went here for lunch and almost left. It took 10 minutes to get drink orders in, than 10 more to get the drinks! Finally got our food order in and waited 20 more minutes. As I was about to arrupt the food showed up. Unbelievable food! I was super pleased. If they could resolve the terrible service this would be a great place with a great menu.

The Tipsy Cow gets five stars for their name. As for their food and drink, they also get five stars.  I've been here a few times now and my go-to is a Bloody Mary with a chaser of Spotted Cow (they don't do chasers outside of Wisco and it's a horribly sad thing). As for the food, well I always go with the Cheese Curds, because these are some of the most amazing Cheese Curds you could have. The bloody is a perfect mix, not too horseradishy and just spicy enough, of course you have some garnishes or snacks as I call them on top. If you're visiting Madison, make this a place to visit as it's worth your time and money!
Order the cheese curds and a tipsy burger. It's a small place that gets crowded on the weekends but it's worth the wait!

So after reading lots of positive reviews on this place we decided to come here on a thursday night with another couple. I was throughly not impressed, it was quite packed for a thursday evening but we only had to wait a couple mins for seating. After getting seated we waited atleast 15 mins just for a waitress to notice us, just for her to comeover and tell us that we would be receiving the "trainee" and she'd be right with us........ another 15 mins go by, no server. If it were just us we would've left but we were with other people. Once the original waitress came to check if the trainee came by and we said no, she took the order. (Mind you this was our drink and meal order) We all ordered drinks me and 2 other got tap beer.. not hard to screw up but my bf got a moscow mull, was made incredibly wrong to where he couldn't even finish it. The food on the other hand definitely not impressed, didn't like either of my things, tomato soup which wasn't even hot, and salmon potato cakes, the salmon was inedible. Our friends got salads (kinda hard to screw up) nothing too exciting and my bf got the tilapia sandwich which was soggy Yuck!! All in all we'd only be back for some of their drink specials, but doubtful.   + server was a sweetheart (short blonde haired girl)  +atmosphere was cool
Great burger.  The appetizers are great and the beer selection is as well.  The only issue is the place is so busy since switching over to Tipsy Cow its hard to get a spot outside.

A great place to get American fried food and craft beer.  I like Tipsy Cow for 3 reasons:  1) They may not have the most incredible, knock your socks off food in the world, but their menu is so fun. They have so many different burgers, sandwiches, and fries. Just a great variety of bar food that gets interesting with influence from all over the world.  2) Their grilled cheese is probably my favorite grilled cheese ever. It's brutally cheesy. I swear theres more cheese than bread on that monster. I think they said they use six different cheeses. That thing will just drip cheese down your arm like a juicy peach (except cheese instead of peach juice).  3) Tipsy Cow always has a solid beer selection with one or two standouts. This weekend, they had Waldo's Special Ale by Lagunitas which had sold out at Trixie's Liquor in one day. This isn't a beer review, but it's a good beer if you ever see it around.
Very friendly bartender and delicious cocktails! Chocolate cookie was also awesome Thanks!

I stopped in while on my road trip.  Street park your car, the meters will take credit cards :)  Inside was smaller then I expected, but they do have outdoor seating, but when it's 90+ outside, I prefer the inside where the AC is running and it's cool :)  I came here because of one thing - fried cheese curd!  Long before my trip started, I spent a lot of time looking places to eat, while I'm sure there are other restaurants that offer fried cheese curds, I bookmarked this place and had to swing by.  So, yeah... ordered the fried cheese curd and the tipsy burger... of course, got a beer as well.  I'm giving 4 stars because of the fried cheese curd!  It was fried perfectly, the cheese was not to overly salty and I ate it like it as popcorn!  I could have consumed this for hours (not recommend for health reasons)!!!    As for their burger, it was juicy, but the meat patties unfortunately lacked flavors... the patties were bland and unfortunately other items in the burger did not bring the seasoning together.  Bit more of seasoned salt on the patties would been awesome!  But definitely recommend the cheese curds!!!

We stopped here on a quick visit to see our daughter, and it was a great little place!  We sat in a booth/table in the back area and it was a warm and cozy place for lunch and a visit.  The service was attentive and friendly, and it had a relaxed atmosphere.  There is some metered parking on the street, but also a ramp across the street (although it's pricey....we paid $12 for about 90 minutes because we didn't see any metered parking available at the time!).  The menu was interesting with something for everyone.  They have about 8 different kinds of topped fries in their appetizer section.  We had the Korean fries which had nice, crunchy fries, Korean BBQ beef, onions and some chopped veggies, and a sriracha mayo.  It was a hit, and lasted about 5 minutes even though it was a decent portion. You just couldn't get enough.  Because the fries were so good, my daughter and I both ordered the Korean BBQ sandwich.  You can get a half order of any appetizer to have as a side to the sandwich so that was really cool!  She ordered a small house salad and that was made with really nice ingredients as well.  The sandwich was good, but not as good as the fries.  It would have been better with just a touch more beef on it since that kind of got lost in the bread and veggies.  My husband had a bowl of their chili and said that was pretty good as well.    This is a fun place with lots of options including many unique choices you don't see everywhere else.  The prices are reasonable with nice sized portions, and the service was great!

After walking around Cows on the Concourse we decided to finally check out The Tipsy Cow (how appropriate, after all).  As we walked up to the door we got to admire all of the delicious food people were eating at the outdoor seating, and it was 2pm already so I was ready for a large meal and a beer. We enter the doors and we're immediately greeted by cow decor everywhere, love it. The whole thing just screamed "THIS IS WISCONSIN."  We were seated shortly with only a brief wait and dropped off at the general seating area of the restaurant (away from the bar) by the hostess. I began to peruse the tap list, and I was immediately disappointed. All of the buzz that I had heard about the tap-list at Tipsy Cow had generally been praise worthy. Unfortunately, the list I was seeing was targeted at burnt hops IPA drinkers. The only malty delicious beer on beverage was a Left-Hand Stout (which I love but have had many times). I ended up settling on a bottle due to the lack of diversity on tap.  Our party put in an order of cheese curds, which arrived with our drinks. The cheese curds were heavily breaded and luke-warm. Overall, they were fairly average. I just wasn't impressed, as I prefer a lighter breading, gooey cheese, and a warmer curd inside. Fortunately, the curds were not greasy at all!  For the main course I ordered a grilled turkey and Havarti sandwich. The sandwich was okay, but it was nothing stellar. It definitely had too much meat on it and not enough cheese/other dressings. It looked like there was about an inch worth of packaged lunch meat on it.  I ordered a side of zucchini chips with the sandwich, and I enjoyed them quite a bit. The chips were cut a little thicker and the breading wasn't too heavy. I appreciate that the chips were not soggy and overcooked. They actually tasted like zucchini, I would recommend them over the cheese curds for a side here.  My friend ended up order alligator bites. I can't speak much for the quality of the bites, as I only have had alligator one other time. I appreciate that Tipsy Cow has an interesting menu item to choose, but I would not recommend it unless you know what to expect. Alligator tends to be a very tough meat, and that quality really came through in the bites. My friend couldn't finish the side, even with the help of my wife and me.  Despite the average food, I think we will return to Tipsy Cow on occasion. I just do not feel blown away by anything specific on the menu. The food is just what I would expect from an average bar in Madison.

WOW - Tipsy Cow delivered on our first visit.  Alex (with an X) took wonderful care of us, introducing us to the Tipsy Cow menu and many options for adult beverages.  We started with Alligator bites, yum and a dark beer and a spiced cider - all excellent.  I tried the Tipsy Cow Burger Saturday special - a couple Knoche Burgers, truffled mushrooms covered with a sunny side egg - WOW! One of the best burgers I've had in years.  She tried the griddled turkey and havarti - loved it.  A real treat on the side was the "Mike's Pickles" - just like Mom used to make - we even took a couple of orders home with us!  If you are visiting the Capitol or Downtown in Madison - stop by the Tipsy Cow - I know you'll enjoy your visit.

We ate dinner here last night after curds and drinks at The Old Fashioned (see prior review).  It was my first time eating at Tipsy and I wanted to try the fish (cod) after the rave reviews on yelp.  My girlfriend had a beer and I had a mojito.  My mojito was lacking sugar...it was heavy on soda taste.  My fish was a mahogany color and delicious but my coleslaw was not as creamy as I like and it was pink.  Don't get me wrong...I'm all for breast cancer awareness....but the pink slaw threw me.  One of Marcia's pieces of fish, about half of it, was like rubber.  She was wondering what was wrong with it so I said give it here....I honestly couldn't bite through it!  I liked this restaurant but if we go back Marcia said she will not order the fish again....that means we will never eat here on a Friday since that's her fish day.    As a side note (don't judge me) I ordered carry out -the taco carnitas platter- for breakfast today.  It was yummy as was Marcia's other piece of fish at 10:30 last night. *wink*  haha good eating everyone!!

My friend and I went in for lunch today.  We've ordered: PBR Battered Fish Tacos, Fried Cheese Curds and Tipsy Burger. We REALLY enjoyed fish tacos and cheese curds. This was our first time trying fish tacos and we both fell in love. Tipsy Burger on the other hand fell flat or should I say fat. It was really greasy.  I would give this place a 5 stars if not for the burger.

This is one of my favorite places in Madison to grab a burger, some curds and a beer. They have a wide variety of burgers as well as a bunch of options for baskets of fries with extra things on top (I tried Korean BBQ last time and it was pretty solid). Good beers on tap and a good vibe.

Went to this place with my three kids only because Yelp rated it good for kids.  Wrong!  This is a bar first and they do not even have a kids menu.  We did not realize there was not a kids menu until after waiting 20 minutes for our table.  At that point we decided to stick it out and split a chicken fritters appetizer with the kids.  Then the lady who brought the water dumped her tray on me and my son.  She said she was sorry, but the waitress and the manager treated us like it was our fault.  Pretty sure they thought one of our kids knocked something over.  I don't even think the manager believed us when we said did not make the mess.  My shirt and pants were completely soaked and I had to walk around the farmers market in the cold and wind with wet clothes.  Not fun!  Do not go here with your children!

Super friendly staff and a wide assortment of gastropub food. What more could you want.  We stopped at the Tipsy Cow for an early Friday afternoon lunch while in Madison for a conference. Although it was early (1130 am), the staff went out of their way to make certain we had a lunch table set-up outside and felt welcome.  The burgers are awesome. They tend to run a bit on the greasy side for me - but the flavors were really nice. I especially liked the truffle fires. Although I wish they had been a bit "crisper."  There is a wide assortment of libations on the menu. However, we did not partake - given the early hour of our lunch and the need for further "work focused" concentration for the rest of the afternoon. I would suggest - a great Friday Happy Hour includes a visit to the Tipsy Cow for a cold beer, truffle fries, burger and salad. That would be a great way to start a weekend.  The restaurant/bars location, in close proximity to the Capitol, means there is never a shortage of people watching and interesting street-happenings. Especially in the summer months when the city of Madison seems to come alive with the warm sunshine and pleasant afternoons.

The Tipsy Burger is awesome. I never eat chili fries, except here. And the beer menu is excellent. I regard Tipsy Cow as an upscale tavern. One downside: the air conditioner can't keep up when it's crowded.

Exactly what I was looking forward to during a trip to the cold north. Delicious fried cheese curds, awesome kielbasa n kraut, huge (!) salads, and just-creative enough drinks.  Not too hard on the wallet, either. Give it a shot if you're in the mood for pub eating.

I love the tipsy cow! This place has great burgers and crazy amazing French fry appetizers! They also have a stellar tap beer selection, though I tend to always get the Crispin Cider Beer. Great place to come, just as good as the Old Fashion but with less of a wait for a table. Oh and AMAZING CHEESE CURDS

When I am downtown Madison I always think about Tipsy Cow. I am a sucker for a good beer, tasty fries, and the perfect chicken wing. They have a great craft beer menu that is always rotating. The menu isn't overwhelming but they have plenty of options for everyone. They also have outdoor seating when the weather is perfect in Wisconsin!   If you like toppings on your fries this is the place to go. I believe they have 7 or 8 different types of loaded fries. The size is enough to share, or to have as a meal. Korean BBQ, Gyro, or Carnitas fries.... need I say more??   The chicken wings are big, non breaded, and perfectly done (in my eyes). I prefer an extra crispy wing, and these are exactly that. I am also a sucker for a dry rub which is exactly what the parmesan peppercorn is. Although I am not a fan of blue cheese dressing they are able to change that to ranch upon request.    Oh and the specials are great!! You can't go wrong with 1/2 priced wings on Monday, and I highly recommend the PBR battered fish taco(s) for $3 on Thursdays!

I played trivia here on a Monday night. They were packed, so much so that we had to grab chairs from outside for everyone to sit around the small table we snagged. As busy as the place was, I was quite impressed with the service; our water was always full and drinks kept getting refilled. This was good because it was sweltering inside. I don't know if it was too many people or a problem with the AC, but it was hot.   The fries were good and the cheese curds looked good. Ill have to come back and get some real food.

When you picture a Wisconsin bar, The Tipsy Cow is exactly what you'd picture. Everything down to the music and the decor adds to the quaint pub feel.   The hamburgers are really good and juicy with a nice burger to bun ratio. The only downside is that there are no fries included. The beer menu is also amazing.  Our waitress was very attentive and the food came and quickly even though it was a busy Friday night. I would definitely go again.

I enjoy the Tipsy Cow food and ambiance and it would be one of my favorite lunch spots but it's near impossible to get in and out of the restaurant in under 90 minutes. 90 minutes isn't a feasible lunch option for most working professionals. They need to get more servers or speed up their kitchen or their lunch crowds will continue to dwindle.

Such a cute place. I love that there's outdoor seating and the adorable cow decor. I tried their fries, aioli sauce, and tipsy burger, which was delish!   They also have a sizeable beer selection which was really great.I read on Yelp that the tipsy cows Bloody Mary was to die for, but when I tried it it seemed to be a generic bloody mix (but you get a spotted cow chaser!)   It was really nice to sit at the bar, read some stuff, and chat with other people at the bar. A lot of the patrons there are very friendly.  Overall, this is a great casual place to get a burger and fries (although the fries don't come w the burger which is a bummer) and some beer during the summer and spring time.
Stopped here for brunch..Service was quick and food was great as well, esp fish and chips & cheese curds. Burger was just average.  Overall, a good place to grab a quick bite or hang out.

That was the best burger I have ever had. The Tipsy Burger uses the best local melt in your mouth ground beef , sharp and delicious aged brick and cheddar cheese, applewood smoked bacon. Lastly, they top it off with a tangy Tipsy sauce that brings out everything else the burger has to offer. Otherwise, great service and good beer selection -like any other popular well managed bar in Wisconsin.

It's been 3 years since my original review and Tipsy continues to be my go-to burger/beer spot.  They recently updated their menu and I am glad to see the lamb burger (often a special) now has a permanent home.  It's one of my all time faves-local lamb, Roth Kase Gruyère , Nueske bacon and a sunny-side egg.  Tipsy has a rotating menu of beers (with spotted cow always holding a spot).  As a man who likes to try any/everything, I appreciate that I can come in and try 1 (or 2 or 3) beers I've never experienced before.

It's doubtful we'll be back to the Cow. Stopped here with my spouse on a beautiful Saturday night about 10pm. The streets were buzzing, with activity all over downtown, and we thought we'd enjoy the lovely evening outside at the sidewalk tables.  We noticed that it said to check with wait staff if we wanted to sit outside, so I asked one of the servers walking by if it was ok. He said, "Sure." That was the last we saw of a server. Well, at our table. We had four different servers walk by us, serve other tables, bring checks, bus tables over ten minute time frame...but not one made eye contact with us or took our order.   The only thing I can figure is that they wanted to close up outside seating, and therefore intentionally ignored us. That's okay: we just will find other places to take our business.

Great Burgers. Great Appetizers. Great beers. Fast Service.  It's the perfect combination for a bar.   They also open some exclusive beers on occasion.  Recently had Dog Fish Head 120 Min IPA.   It's a great combination, I've been here for lunch, and for dinner, and all of the above were true.   Most of the times I've noticed the same bar tender, and give props to the guy.  He runs a good ship, and kept our drinks at the ready, and food handy when we sat at the bar.  Often at lunch they have the Burger with Guac and bacon on the menu.   Not something I'd normally order.  On an adventurous day I ordered it.... and am now in a rut because that's all I want to order.
We ordered lunch to go for a picnic and everything was accurate.  Found tasted great. Loved the variety.

I was in town for business.  I did my Yelp research, and my Beer Advocate research before getting into town.  The Tipsy Cow kept showing up high on every list.  Had to make it one of my limited stops while in town.    From all I had heard about their beer selection, honestly I was a bit disappointed.  There are a number of other spots within a very short walk with a much deeper selection.    The Tipsy Cow was also the youngest / college crowd / hipster type places of all I had stopped.  Not that there is anything wrong with that....  all depends on what you are looking for.  Monday night trivia - this i the place.  Great location, nice outdoor seating option, good beer selection, delicious curds.

The Tipsy Cow is a good bar with good bar food. I don't usually make this my destination but if I'm hopping around by the Capital it's in my Top 10.   +Good beer list, nice variety +Goat Cheese Curds, Alligator Bites, Juicy Burgers, Truffle Fries +Right next to like 6 other bars in case you are hopping around.  -They get busy sometimes and it gets packed -The food isn't free -I'm sad because I'm not there right now

We had really high hopes for this joint- and the atmosphere/beer/service was good but the food we got was dripping. My husbands burger was swimming in a pool of grease an my smoked salmon grilled cheese was smothered in that fake butter flavored oily yuck. Went at 2pm on a Saturday after a big lunch rush so maybe we just times it poorly? We wanted to love it. Maybe next time
Had the corn and avocado salad with crispy chicken and the pork sandwich.  Both were amazing. The service was very good and the outdoor tables perfect for a summer day.

I've only been here for a beer, so I can't speak to the quality of the food. The beer selection is good, with craft choices from Wisconsin and elsewhere. I had a Three Floyd's IPA from Illinois while killing sometime at the bar. Weekday happy hour offers $1.00 off draft beers. What I like best is the feng shui or feel of the place. The long classy old wooden bar reaches across the diagonal streets right across from the Capitol, and the restaurant is a cozy pie-shaped affair with street views. I have a thing for pie-shaped rooms.   Perusing the menu, one finds an extensive array of the "usual suspect" starters(chips, fries, dips, wings and curds), a few salads and soups, and a pretty extensive sandwich board. Items which caught my eye under starters: Truffle Fries and Korean BBQ fries, and sandwiches: Grilled Turkey and Havarti, Truffled Portabella Mushroom. The Housemade Pork Carnita Tacos are something I will need to come back for. There are also other Taco specials on Wednesdays and Thursdays, and of course the requisite Wisconsin Friday Fish Fry.  The Tipsy Cow is a great casual downtown pub with a cozy atmosphere and standard pub fare with a few unexpected items. A place to pop in for lunch or dinner when you're near the Capitol. Very friendly staff, too. Prices are just what you'd expect for this casual fare.

The path from the Local Tavern to King and Mane to now the Tipsy Cow has been worth the wait. Matthew, Sue, Michael, Patrick, Carl etc. and the rest are working hard to make this place great. Kudos to all the "Tipsy Cow Crew".  Great service,cold beer, well-made cocktails, well-prepared, tastefully executed dishes in a busy environment while recognizing regulars and new patrons is nothing short of amazing in this new concept. I will enjoy enjoy watching the success that is meant for this place that will always be my "Local Tavern". Thank you for all the work you do to make this local tavern named the Tipsy Cow a success at  King and Main!
Very good food and drink. I was able to order a delicious gluten free beer, and also sit outside with my dog.

Stopped here for drinks one night!!! Great little place with an excellent drink menu and atmosphere.  We didn't have any food (probably should have)  but what we saw looked really great!  I will be goin back to try the food!!
Greasy af burgers bruh  Onion rings are pretty darn good, as are the bartenders  Word to the wise: "steak tacos" are ground beef tacos  All in all a good burger and beer joint but not worth a detour
Great beer selection,  and typical bar food. The only thing that was a not good was the seating outside we had a group of 6 but they sat us around a table for three.

Came here for dinner while I was in town for a basketball game.  This is a great place to grab a casual bite to eat.  It was totally packed when we were there and we had a bit of a wait, but the bar is easily accessible, and there are quite a few beer options to enjoy while you wait.  We chose the garlic fries and goat cheese curds as appetizers for the table.  Both were incredible.  The goat cheese curds are kind of rich so unless you are totally in love with goat cheese you are going to probably want to split these with someone.  I got a salad for dinner that I very much enjoyed.  The ingredients seemed super fresh, well above expectations for a burger joint.  My friends all enjoyed burgers, that they said were also delicious.  I will definitely be back!

Stopped by the Tipsy for some al fresco dining the other night and it was lovely. Last fall (or maybe two?) their tomato soup hooked me and I've stayed for their house turkey sandwich.   First, the soup: velvety, spicy, and served with a cheese curd. A lot of tomato soups seem to border on tomato juice, but this definitely doesn't taste like it came out of a can.   Second, the sandwich: tasty turkey, crisp greens, crispier bacon, and a delicious kick from the whole grain mustard. That spice is extra nice, especially because I upgrade my sandwich to include creamy avocado as well. I've got myself half ready to drive over right now just writing about this. I love a good sandwich.   Third, the curve ball: on this trip, my friends and I split the Korean BBQ fries that were featured as a special. The beef was incredibly tender, the fries themselves at once crispy and creamy, and the sauce just really pulled it together. I'll have to keep an eye out for them on the menu again because it was a nice out of the box treat I normally wouldn't think to order for myself.

There was a short wait and they take your cell phone to message you when your table is ready.  We waited outside for a little bit to get away from the crowd at the bar as it was cool outside but got pretty warm quickly inside.  The bar area is quite loud not necessarily from people talking but the surroundings and ceiling which echo the noise easily.  We were told we would be seated in one of the best places which ended up by the back window in the bar area.  It was just too loud for us as it was really hard for us to converse normally.  The cheese curds were ok as there were a couple of large pieces but most of them were very small.  The tipsy cow burger was good.  The buns couldn't hold up the burger patties or bacon but the taste was good.  My wife's salad was also good.  I was a little disappointed at the beer selection as there were so many IPAs with only 1 porter, 1 fruit beer, although there were nearly all local selections from Wisconsin, Minnesota, or Illinois.  Overall, a good place to hang out for a beer but maybe not if you are here for the gastropub portion.

I've been to the Tipsy Cow three times and every time the food has been great. The cheese curds are some of the best I've ever had, with a light breading and gooey cheese on the inside. They also have a variety of different specialty fries. My family and I got the garlic truffle fries and they were delicious. The Tipsy chicken sandwich is also delicious, with a surprisingly strong mustard that goes really well on the sandwich.

This is one of my favorite summer places in Madison. Great outdoor seating for people watching and excellent greasefood. I'm finicky with my non-meat burgers--they're never done quite right--but TC does a wonderful job with their portabella mushroom burger. They actually do everything quite well, and I haven't heard of a lackluster option on their menu. Friends from out-of-state usually want to go to the Old Fashioned when in town, but I'm going to steer them here from now on.

Can I do 0 stars? Server didn't seem like he wanted to be here didn't know specials could barely coax a word out of him, and it was a ghost town. Reviews tell all, probably not worth ur hardearned  dollars. Granted his saving grace was he didn't charge us for the pops we ordered before we decided to leave. They were flat and terrible but good on him for doing the right thing.

I inadvertently came here on trivia night just before it started but was able to find a seat at the bar to grab a beer and some bar food.  Previous Yelp reviews raved about the gyro fries which I found to just be OK.  The cheese curds, however, were fantastic.  I had a great beer and would have liked to sit on the patio had it not been sprinkling.  The trivia looked like it would be fun if I was with a group next time!  I had to pay for my food with a credit card and my beer with cash and the bartender was not annoyed at all by my request which was a relief since it was so busy.  Overall this was a great bar experience and I'd definitely return for cheese curds and a beer (or two).

Returned to Madison and hit Tipsy Cow and of course ordered the cheese curds again and they were terrific yet again.  Hubby and I shared some other stuff, too. He got wings in garlic parmesan and honey harissa flavors. The harissa was strong and distinctly flavored in a North African kind of way--an acquired taste but super good with blue cheese dressing (if you're wary). He also got the Korean beef fries and he was super happy. We split the walleye sandwich and the slaw on it (while heavy) was a great complement.  Tipsy Cow is a fantastic stop in Madison and I still recommend it wholeheartedly.

I'm torn on this one- the food was good, but the atmosphere/clientele/service, not so much. i'll say four stars for the food, two for the everything else.  three of us had dinner here last night. we put our names in for a table, were told the wait would be 30 minutes (not bad for a saturday), and were seated shortly at a table near the bar... right on top of not one, but two groups of completely wasted, obnoxious kids. hooray, maybe we'll get puked on!  so on top of the place being uncomfortably packed, it was hot and loud as hell. LOUD, like my throat hurts today from having to scream over the (mostly) shitty music they were blaring in order to have a conversation loud. this annoys me to no end. does anyone honestly enjoy that? is there a logical reason why establishments do this? ugh. I digress.  our waitress came immediately, which is cool, but she was pushy. she acted annoyed that we'd had a whole 5 seconds to peruse the menu and didn't know what we wanted to order. she gave us a minute and when she came back, we ordered our beers, sour cream fries and chili cheese fries. these came out quickly, but they were literally shoved onto our table by our rude ass waitress. (both kinds of fries were delicious, however.)   i ordered a tipsy burger for my meal, the bf had a 2x2, and our friend had the portabella sandwich. we were all happy with our food. my burger was a tad on the greasy side, but that didn't stop me from being a fatty and eating the whole thing.   overall, I wish that I could take the atmosphere/clientele/service from the local tavern and the food from the tipsy cow and bring the local tavern back from the dead. the food was decent, but I don't see myself hanging out here very often.
Delicious sweet-meets-sour old fashioned. Don Draper would be proud.  Also snagged the Friday night deal on $3 Hoppalicious. Any place where the Ale Asylum is flowing freely is the place for me.
Do not visit downtown Madison without eating at Tipsy Cow! Blue Cheese Bacon Fries are Devine! Good food and great service

While the competition for newest and most trendy cuisine rages in various downtown Madison, several restaurants prefer to languish in the baser menu options that give Wisconsin it's identity.  One of these is The Tipsy Cow, which features burgers using the local Knoche's ground beef for a signature local taste that is getting wider recognition.  On my last outing, I tried the Tilapia sandwich, which at $7 turned out to be an outstanding value.  The fillet size was much larger and more flavorful than the last attempt I made at a different venue.  Sadly, the waitress forgot about my onion rings until the sandwich was consumed.  Under normal circumstances, I may have asked to waive the charge, but the sandwich was so good that I didn't care.  FYI- the onion rings practically have the thickness and fat content of donuts, so if you are watching your intake, consider yourself warned.  UPDATE-On a recent Friday night return visit, the place was packed, but I took a chance on the Fish Fry. One hour later, no food and I was outta there.

It was very empty during the day (it's a sports bar, so this is expected). We were warmly greeted by a friendly waitress as soon as we walked in. The menu has pretty limited selection, but they have curry and breakfast foods, along with the regular pub foods. Even though there were only two other tables, it took pretty long to get our food (about 30 minutes?). The appetizers came with our entrees at the same time too. Food was meh... I got the Sheppard's Pie. They drowned the pie in gravy, and the beef underneath was very salty. Expected for a sports bar I guess! Won't be coming back for their non-pub food.
Hands down my favorite bar in Madison. Cozy atmosphere filled with some amazing souls and delicious food. Food is decently priced- $5-$15 as well as daily specials that can knock off a few bucks.
I stopped for a late lunch on a beautiful summer day and sat outside. The turkey sandwich with avocado was tasty, the fries were great and the service excellent. The price was decent as well.

Saw they had Alligator on the online menu and absolutely HAD to have it for a fried birthday treat. So I drove to Madison and walked 6 blocks during rush hour to get it. No regrets, it was delicious. The spiciness was perfect (any more and it would be painful), the sauce was delicious, and so crispy. Will definitely be back.

This place is awesome!!  Came here with my family while visiting Madison and boy was it delicious. The restaurant itself is located beautifully in the heart of Madtown and parking is very convenient either in a nearby lot or on the street. It has a bar and tables and is an excellent places to chill with friends, grab some drinks, or get lunch with the family.   We got a lot of things off the menu. The cheese curds are comparable to AJ Bomber's, the gyro fries are really really good, and the fish taco was excellent. Our main entrees including a grilled cheese with bacon, chicken burger, and other burgers were all top-notch, had amazing flavor, and the quality was above and beyond. I highly recommend anything mentioned above. They also have an extensive menu of local, domestic, and import beers so that's awesome too!  Our waitress was also super sweet and kind and we felt at home and very comfortable during our meal. Props to them. Overall, 10/10 would recommend. Great food, great vibes.

I took the better half for lunch and really enjoyed it.  I started off with the three bean beef chili which was incredible. A very hearty soup full of meat. For my meal I had the turkey sandwich. It was absolutely delicious. The sandwich comes with freshly roasted turkey, nueske's bacon, and a spicy mustard sauce. The girlfriend had a slightly different turkey sandwich with soft cheese on it. This place is a must try for lunch.

Someone I know was hungover and all they wanted was a grilled cheese. This place is the spot! Best grilled cheese I have ever had, hands down. It is easy to make simple items good. It is harder to make simple items excellent. The buffalo wings are exceptional as well. It was less expensive than I remember too. Still really loud in the bar area.
The thing about this place is my friends always want to go here, and I'm not sure why other than location. Service tends to be sub par at times. Beer was warm for my liking yet good selection.
They have the most amazing goat cheese curds. Great beer selection that changes frequently. Wait staff was very attentive even though they were extremely busy. Can't wait to go back.

Delicious, flavorful, and creative (for the type of place this is... this is a beer and burger type joint) food that uses a lot of local products, such as Usinger's sausages, Knoche's Market beef, Clasen's bread, etc. I have never been disappointed with any of the dishes we've had here.   We are fried food afficionados, and Tipsy Cow has some of the best fried stuff in town. The cheese curds were large and just had a little more character than your usual cheese curd from its Spotted Cow beer batter and seasoning. The various types of fries--we go for either the regular, truffle, or chili cheese--are delicious, too, though they can be a bit on the greasy side. I also don't mind when my kids don't finish their meals: it means I can finish off their crispy chicken fritters, again with a delicious batter and real moist chicken (at one point they had corn dogs, which blew out of the water any other corn dog I had ever had).    And then, of course, their burgers are great. At first glance, you might think that you're getting ripped off from the size of the burgers, but they have so much flavor (and, admittedly, grease) from the local ingredients that we often found ourselves satiated after scarfing our food down. The Tipsy Burger is good, but we much prefer the Bacon Guacamole Cheeseburger, which I don't believe is on the menu but is a regular special (I think?)
