It's a delicious combination of different textures and flavors. I also highly recommend the grilled cheese if you want something "lighter".  I've tried Tipsy Cow several times and though the service isn't mind-blowingly amazing, I never really had any major qualms with my servers. The noise level can be a little overbearing, too, but the food is so good AND they pay homage to Monty Python and the Holy Grail with a chalk panorama of the cow scene. Bonus.

I came here for lunch in a party of 4, and had a Cobb salad and a soft drink. Our food was out quickly and the salad was a good size and exactly what I ordered (nothing too exciting). Our waitress was polite and refilled drinks as needed. Oh -- and outdoor seating, which is nice.

If you're looking for amazing bar food with a Wisconsin flair but don't want to wait in line at the Old Fashioned, look no further!  Their cheese curds are all delicious (regular, goat cheese or buffalo). Their burger is AMAZING - probably the best I've tried in Madison. Overall a great place to grab a quick bite of awesome food or drink some Wisconsin beer without the hassle of the other Capitol square spots.

Service: Spot on for how busy it was-my glass was never empty and we were seated IMMEDIATELY which we did not expect based on the line out the door. Our food came fast at a lunch rush and our waitress was very helpful explaining what was popular on the menu.   Atmosphere: Weird little layout, but very homey, a place you want to keep drinking and eating for an extended period of time; you will want to come back.  Food: THE BEST CHEESECURDS EVERRRR. EVER. I am a cheese curd fanatic (who isn't from the state of WI), and I have never wanted to shove cheese into my mouth as quickly as I did last summer with my boyfriend when we stopped in here. The breading is so light, you really get to appreciate the flavor and texture of the cheese. We ordered both kinds, the goat cheese and the regular. I would order those goat cheese curds every day and dedicate my waistband size to sweatpants if I lived in Madison. The bloody mary was spot on-I could eat a whole jar of their homemade pickles. The grilled cheese with bacon was crispy on the outside and ooey-gooey on the inside, just like I like it.  Whenever I find out a friend or relative is heading in this direction I always recommend this fantastic establishment. I should have wrote this review sooner to give my praises.

Some carb loading before the Ironman 70.3 on June 11. Walking distance from the Hilton Madison. Very pleased - had read other Yelp reviews.  Comfortable seating at a high top by the bar. When you put bread/cheese/egg/asparagus all together, you're going to get a clean plate. Fortunately, I snapped a pic of this excellent lunch before I devoured all of it.   Seriously  and only $7 or $9 I think. In DC where I live, that would have been priced at $15...really.   YUM!

COST: $3 (Jamison Shot) $5-10 (Variety of beer)  I was going to say it was pretty non descript but with the name like that, fancy neon light and how it's dead smack in one of the Capitol Square's corner, it hits you in the face and for good reason.  Pretty nice bar, obviously poppin on a Friday night. I didn't get to try their food but for the service and the decor, they get four stars.

A friend recommended coming here for dinner, and I agreed. This isn't too bad of a joint. It's homey with a friendly waitress. We went on a Tuesday, and there was trivia going on. We didn't stay too late and left before trivia really began, so I did not really get to hear the kinds of questions being asked. We sat at a side table against the wall but across from the bar - a good people watching spot.  Frankly it's hard to mess up a grilled cheese and fries, but they were pretty good. I love the use of local cheese! My friend ordered the cheese curds for us, and they were pretty good. They were salty enough but didn't make your teeth squeak. I still think the Old Fashioned has the best cheese curds because they're crunchier but lighter there. This is a reason why I gave this place three stars. I would return again though!  Grilled cheese with bacon $6.50 Large fry $2.00 Tax $0.56

Truffle fries and cheese curds are enough delicious oily food to make your heart stop. Round it out with a beer and a guacamole bacon burger (or whatever burger you have on special) and spend your afternoon half way between blissful food coma and full on heartburn!   The kielbasa is not bad either. Overall, I would come back a few times!!

Tipsy Cow offers a great bar environment to enjoy beers and food while having a great conversations with friends. Not sure if the winter day plays a big role, but I went with a couple of friends and was able to listen to each other's stories. I feel such place is difficult to find in bars near the area.  Pro: - Great place to hangout with friends and actually have a conversation - Decent selection of beers - Amazing cheese curds and onion rings  Con: - N/A  Their cheese curds might be one of the unsung dairy delights in Madison. The batter is crispy, while the cheese is gooey enough to not be messy. The curd itself is not too overwhelming, and does not always need the dipping sauce to make it taste amazing.   They also have one of the best onion rings in town. The batter is crispy and flavorful, and the onion maintains its integrity throughout. When was the last time you are able to cut through an onion ring and manage to have a clean cut? We ordered a half-size and got 3 jumbo-sized rings. Definitely something worth wondering if you want to have a taste without worrying of getting too full.  I ordered Tequila Chicken Sandwich for my entree. They are tasty and have decent flavor. It is something I would eat again next time I return. The beer selections are quite extensive to make  me come back and explore more.

I really want to like this place more but with so many good burger/sandwich/beer options in the area it's hard. Service is spotty-some times it's great, sometimes the bartenders treat you as though they are doing you a favor by pouring you a beer.

When I first read the reviews to this place, what I understood was: excellent food, terrible service.  I took the advice of ordering the Tispy burger and cheese curds and I was NOT disappointed! This is the best burger I've ever had (although I have yet to try out the other popular burger joints in Madison). The cheese curds too - the breading is soft and light - more cheese than breading which is always a plus.  I don't know if the reviews about bad service were just out of date - but I've never had a bad experience at the Tipsy Cow. The servers are very attentive and I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for my food. The only time this doesn't apply is if you're sitting outside. If you're on the patio, expect more of a wait.  Overall, one of my favorite places to grab a burger and beer. Highly recommended!

Stopped here for dinner after Concerts on the Square on Wednesday night. Ran into some good friends who had just eaten there and they assured us that it was very good.  The extensive menu sounded very promising... Many different appetizers, including Cajun alligator bites. We ordered the cheese curds, which a friend has since told me are actually goat cheese curds. They were very good, and probably my favorite part of the meal.   So... I ordered off the specials menu, a Cuban sandwich. My first warning sign should have been that they serve it on honey wheat bread. An odd choice for such a traditional sandwich. Our very pleasant and efficient waitress was happy to oblige with the more traditional grilled bun. When it arrived it looked very good.  Unfortunately, looks are where the goodness ended. It was filled with very dry and odd tasting and weirdly textured shaved pork. I love pork and this did not taste like pork, hard to say exactly what it tasted like but it wasn't good. I tried to salvage the meal by taking that off the sandwich. The shaved ham was fine, very tasty, the Havarti cheese was also fine, as well as the yellow mustard and grilled bun.  The death knell for this sandwich was the unfortunate addition of sweet pickles. On a Cuban sandwich? Whaaaaa....? The menu proudly calls them Mike's pickles, and apparently they are a feature here in many dishes. Even the deep fried battered pickles are apparently made from these sweet pickles according to the menu, so be warned. Some things are just wrong. So, so wrong.  The turkey avocado sandwich was pretty stellar, a fellow diner said. The beer list, ambience, location and service are all impeccable. So they get three stars for now, pending future visits.  But please, no more Mike's pickles. (Sorry, Mike. Let's just be friends.)

The Cheese curds!   The Blue Cheese and Bacon Fries!!   The Korean BBQ Fries!! The BEET SALAD!  Amazing little place near the Capital.  The place is a little snug, but the food is exceptionally worth it!!  I love sitting at the bar and taking a gander at all the brews they offer and snacking on some good eats.  If you're looking for something with a little twist on Wisconsin eats, this is your place.  Reasonable prices, fast service, cold beer, good burgers!

Expect to wait if you go during a busy time. Their outdoor seating practically doubles their available tables, so try to go on a nicer day and you'll probably increase your chances of getting a table quicker. Then again, it'd probably be busier as well, so good luck!  That said, wait for a table. This is one of those restaurants where if the host says it will be a 45 minute wait you should gladly do so!  Tip: Sandwiches come a la carte. Sides can be ordered (such as their delicious Ale Asylum cheese curds or their sour cream and chive fries) in a 'family size' or individual. Smart money is on the family size for about $2-3 more to get a bigger portion and share with the table.  Everyone I was with absolutely loved their sandwiches. Fresh ingredients, amazing seasoning on everything, delicious appetizers, and best of all this place has drink specials on the weekend if you're going for a later dinner. Will definitely return!

Best cheese curds. Love the spotted cow beer! My husband ordered the Bloody Mary with a spotted cow chaser. Delicious.  My brother and his wife had the burgers- good as always. I tried the asparagus and egg sandwich. It come open faces with melted asiago cheese. I got the aioli on the side and the egg over medium. Delicious !  Next time I would ask for no parmesan. Will be back!  Great variety of beer.

Tipsy Cow is frequent choice of mine for delicious food and great beer. The Korean beef fries and juicy burgers will not disappoint! The beer selection varies, but there's always a few IPAs to choose from which is always a plus. The salmon grilled cheese is often on special and I cannot get enough of it.   Last night we received text alerts for a table, which I believe is newer and quite helpful. We were quickly offered a table by the restrooms, but opted to sit at the bar instead.   The wait staff is not always on their game, but they also seem to change quite a bit so it's often newer employees. The bartenders are attentive and friendly, and we've noticed the food tends to come faster. Last night we received a few tastes of new drafts which is always a plus. Unfortunately their specific brew "Fugly Duckling" was a little too pungent for us - but to each their own.  While the wait staff performance depends on the day and time, we've never had too much trouble. If you're happy to sit at the bar, it's my favorite part of the restaurant by far. And the food cannot be beat.

It is overused on Yelp!  We have all said it, and today I am going to say it again....  The Tipsy Burger may be the" best burger I have ever eaten".  Buy this time I mean it!    The Tipsy burger is a classic double, with 2 strips of top notch bacon, 2 different types of cheese (including 3 year old Wisconsin Cheddar!) along with "Tipsy Sauce" which I believe is souped up thousand island dressing.    My mouth is still watering thinking about how good this burger is!  You have to try it.  We also ordered a 1/2 side of Onion Rings and a 1/2 side of Goat Cheese Curds.  I liked the Goat Curds a lot.  (Another must try!) the onion rings where good, but were very bready.  Some people might love their rings like this, I tend to like the thinner variety.  I was also please with the prices.  The Tipsy Burger was $8 and I really like that you could order 1/2 sides for half price.    Oh yeah..  also tried the Kentucky Pumpkin Beer.  I thought it sucked!  But I hate almost all craft beers so please don't put much into my review of any beer!        To be completely honest I really should have taken a point off for the service.  We ate outside and it took forever to get refills and our bill.  BUT the food was so good it was worth the wait!

Bar food al fresco  Returning home from vacation to an empty refrigerator, we decided to journey downtown to enjoy the some al fresco dining.  After finding several kid-friendly options on the menu, the Tipsy Cow became our dining destination.    Things I liked: * Gotta start with those cheese curds.  They came out piping hot, lightly breaded and not overly greasy.  I only wish there was another option rather than the very pedestrian ranch dressing that accompanied them.  They deserve better. * The chicken salad really exceeded expectations.  The chicken was plentiful, moist and well-seasoned.  Crunchy tortilla strips added texture and strips of orange added a little brightness to the dish.  The cilantro-based dressing complemented the dish well and became the preferred landing spot for the cheese curds as the meal progressed. * The grilled cheese on the kid's menu was a step above average based on a small nibble my daughter let me have.  The way my daughter defended the sandwich from my repeated attempts to sample it tells me she enjoyed it as well.   * The outdoor seating area is outstanding.  The tables are densely packed, but view of the square on a warm summer evening can't be beat.  Things I didn't: * I wasn't blown away by the Tipsy burger.  It came out a little dry and the tipsy sauce caused the bottom half of the bun to turn to goo.  I appreciated that I could get fried onions on the burgers, but they were not cooked long enough to get any good caramelization.  While I enjoyed the Neuske's bacon, I needed to tear the two pieces in half so they would fit inside the bun. * We had to wait inside the bar while an outdoor table opened up and it was LOUD, even at 7pm.  I'm so glad we were able to get a table outside. * I probably had a better chance of seeing the Loch Ness Monster in Lake Monona than my server once I received the food.  My plans for getting more of the cilantro dressing for the cheese curds were foiled by a wait staff that could not keep up with a Tuesday night crowd.  I shudder to think what things are like on a busy Friday night.  Despite the service issues, I plan to return during the months where I can enjoy the outdoors seating area.  The Thursday special of PBR battered fish tacos looks especially enticing.

Definitely coming back to The Tipsy Cow.  Service  was slow but the food made up for it. We went on a Tuesday so it was a buy one get one half off for the 1x1 cheeseburgers. Finding out from Yelp that you can order half an appetizer was a godsend, allowing us to try both the alligator and the cheese curds for a total of $20 for a dinner, including tip.  The burgers are a little greasy but still good. The cheese curds are good and the ranch that accompanies it is even better.   AND THE ALLIGATOR. My friend and I were super stoked to try alligator and we weren't disappointed. The texture was kind of like chicken but with a slightly flakier texture, which I was not expecting since I had heard alligator to be kind of tough.  The outer breading of the alligator was this perfectly crunchy coating, similar to what you would find on really great fried chicken. The sauce was delicious as well.  I honestly can't wait to check out this place soon for trivia and try some more of their appetizers with friends just because there are so many enticing things on there. GO GO GO GO GO TO THE TIPSY COW!!
Good food. Nice place. Good beer. Goat cheese curds. Spotted cow. Lots of cows, everywhere. More cows than people. Cows in the corner, on the wall... always watching, always knowing...

Came here with my boyfriend and a friend from college I haven't seen in years. It was a great place to grab a few drinks and dinner. Better yet we were able to sit outside. We got the goat cheese cheese curds, I got the special of the day which were Korean beef tacos, boyfriend got the tipsy burger, and my friend got the lox sandwich. Everything was delicious! Great beer selection. This is a great stop. Coming again for sure!

Where do I even begin?! After waiting almost an hour to be seated, we were told by the bartender who said he was manager named Patrick that we would then have to wait for our drinks because he was just too busy to help us and on top of  that didn't bother to ask the other 2 bartenders tbat were standing around on their phones. Once we finally did get seated and since we couldnt even get drinks while waiting for a table.....3 different severs that we tried stopping for service of any sorta and they all kept telling us that sorry but they aren't out servers....not "oh I'm sorry do you know who your sever is or what she looks like so I can maybe get her attention, or Maybe I could help you....we just kept being pawned off to other employees.... finally we said enough is enough and we told the bartender we have been waiting such and such time, and he said and I quote " what would you like me to do about?" Me and my family turned around and will never be back! Worst service iv ever had!

This place is so good I ended up going twice in one day.  For lunch I had the thin and crispy burger.  Very flavorful and so delicous.  For dinner I tried their fried walleye sandwich and a half order of onion rings.  Amazing. The onion rings are probably the best I've ever had easily.  The walleye was perfect.  Can't go wrong with either choice.

Last minute decision to check this place out for a lunch spot and it.was.perfect. Great atmosphere and delish food options and lots of great beer choices for the hubs. The waitress told us they do outdoor seating in the summer, which must be awesome because of the corner they are on!  I can highly recommend the items below that our table tried: Cheese curds Korean BBQ fries * amazing flavor, so much food Steak sandwich (special of the day) Steak tacos Tipsy burger * I wish I had gotten this!   This will be a repeat on our next visit to Madison!
Came for an early evening appetizer and a drink with friends.  Easily accommodated a party of 10 in the outside patio area.  Great server.  Fun atmosphere.  Great location actually.

We sat outside on a Sat. afternoon. Service was pretty mediocre. (Slow, had to ask for what we needed including waters, and milk/cream for the coffee)  Food was fine, nothing special. Loved the pickles on the plate, though!

Used to love going here for lunch as it was close to work and had a good selection. The last time we were there 2 co-workers and I sat at the bar, and during the course of lunch had not one, but two cockroaches crawl across the bar in front of us. Not only will we never be back, we also made sure to let the rest of our co-workers know about our experience. Sad, as it was a really convenient location for us.

Waited 50 mins for a table... Several parties we're taken before us, the host was very rude and switched seat order  several times. My name was on the top of the list and then moves down a few minutes later. Walked out and then received a text our table was ready. Went down the street to another restaurant which accommodated us very quickly.

Went to satisfy a burger craving that I hadn't been able to shake with your typical fast food variety. The tipsy burger was just what I needed and I could tell that the ingredients that went into this meat sandwich were top notch and well thought out (loved the cheese). Being able to pick from any of their expansive variety of side options (half order) put this meal over the top for me (truffle fries for me and sour cream and onion for the wife) both great. Definitely want to try more from this establishment.

This review is for Tierney.  (I hope that's right. It's what my receipt says.) I don't usually single out servers, but she was so incredible (as was the awesome hostess on Monday night) that I feel like I need to mention her by name.   Our group of yelpy trivia players this past Monday grew from 4 to 5 to 7 to 9 to 12 over the course of an hour or so, and each time we needed to add more seats and swap people about, she knew exactly where people were and what they ordered. With each arrival she brought a menu, ran through the food specials time and time again (poor thing... it's fries and wings y'all... half off... every Monday... now you know) and made sure that pints were full of Yelp's Bursting Red Ale and that we felt tended to.   Tipsy Trivia is one of my favorites in town, simply because almost everyone who's there on Monday plays. I have to imagine the servers aren't as excited about it as I am. Cheap fries, cheap wings, growing party sizes... it's probably a server nightmare. But ours was a breath of fresh air and for pub grub and beer, it was probably some of the best service I've received in Madison.   As for the food, it's what you'd expect. I've always felt the burgers are a little over cooked, but you can stack 'em high, so that's a plus. Parmesan wings were a touch overwhelming, but the standard and the Asian glazed made mouths happy. And rotating taps keep things interesting, and it was exciting to see some "locals" (midwest but not Madison) that I had never heard of.
Spotted cow on tap which was great and the cheese curds were tasty, although I've had better. Service sucked. 5pm happy hour on a weekday and 1 guy tending bar. Very slow service.

Basic pub fare. Good service with warm and friendly waitstaff. Had the beet salad, tasty. Burgers looked good. My friend ordered it rare but it came medium, still juicy.  No wait on a Saturday 7 pm.  Good beer selection.

This is a classic Wisconsin restaurant with some great alternative options for those looking to try something new (aka the alligator bites). The staff was a bit reserved but were always helpful when needed. The cheese curds hit the spot and made the trip worth it. We paired our dinner with a couple beers that truly hit the spot. This restaurant also offers great lunch specials.
Good drinks and good bar food! Nothing is gonna blow you away but you'll never be disappointed! The PBR fish tacos on Thursday are very good tho

My friends and I ended up here after checking another nearby restaurant which had a long wait (not surprising on a Saturday night).  Added to that the other restaurant was too loud for extended conversation.  Despite the heat we took the risk of sitting outside at the Tipsy Cow as the bar area where they had seating was also noisy.  It worked out well as it was starting to cool and there was a nice breeze.   We had a very friendly server who gave us space to chat and consider our orders.  He was also very attentive to our water glass levels throughout our stay which was essential on a hot evening.  They had a lot of different food and drink specials which all sounded good.  There were three of us and we  decided to each get a different taco dish which we then shared so that we each had one of each kind.  They were all delicious and we were happy with our sharing idea.  We would have lingered except that dark clouds were rolling in and rain seemed imminent.  I will be back should I find myself downtown hungry and/or thirsty!

First off, this isn't a restaurant it's a pub. This is not a sit-down place. It's not for families or conversation as it was screaming loud there as well.   The majority of it is a high top bar that stretches through the center. It smells weird af in there and I assume it's cigarette smoke on the clothes and people smoke right outside the door. Ok cool... But shouldn't it smell like food? No? Ok my bad.  Swear to god I thought host was on coke. He was bug-eyed, talked fast without a purpose and really jumpy. I could see why you'd want to be on it in that place though. I had questions about the menu, none of which he could answer like... idk prices and portion size. The burgers don't come with fries. Everything is separate. EVERYTHING.   I asked the host what their fries looked like "steak, crinkle-cut, or shoe string". He just stared at me and danced around all jittery said he didn't know. I said "you know like fast food style or what?" He said "like normal fries" and explained they looked like "pens". Ooookay... So shoestring. Fast food style. Got it. And he didn't know how much they were - like he had never been asked that...  Needless to say, I left.  No thank you.

I had one of the best beers ever! And they let you taste a sample. My wife and I were in search of something quick, yet good. We were visiting Madison to celebrate her birthday. Someone from our hotel recommended this place.   I have to say that the burgers we ordered were off the chain! I had the lamb burger with a order of cheese curds. My wife had the chicken sandwich with truffle fries. Delicious!   For the price and atmosphere, I would say it is well worth the visit. Enjoy!

Find me a burger that tops the Tipsy Burger. Jk - you can't.   Not a light meal at all, but if you're looking for a burger to end all burgers (complete with grease running down to your elbows), you've found the place. A good quality patty, topped with some stellar cheese, onions, bacon and the special tipsy sauce...you've got it made.   Had several entrees here besides the Tipsy Burger - all of which have been great. The sides come separate, but are equally delicious. Truffles fries, bacon and blue cheese fries or cheese curds are a few of my favorites.   Definitely worth a stop on your next visit to downtown Madison.
The hostess was rude. I waited for over 5 mins for a drink. I don't get the hype about this place.

I haven't really had a chance to try their food, but the few items I have tried are great. I really adore their French fries, cheese curds, and onion rings.   But The Tipsy Cow is where my friends and I like to go on a Friday or Saturday nights for our first few rounds of drinks. With $3 Jameson shots, $3 Bacardi mixers, and $3 captain Morgan mixers, it's a great way to get buzzed without breaking the bank!   The bartenders are great and attentive. They know how to make the drinks strong enough to taste the alcohol but being still able to enjoy the drinks.   The Tipsy cow is also just a cute, little dark restaurant and bar with a nice, underground feel to it. It's one of those places that gets you hooked after one time being there.
Great place and atmosphere.  Fries were awesome, wish the chicken sandwich was better and bigger.

I love this place. For someone who strongly dislikes busy, overcrowded, loud restaurants... I don't mind it here at all.  For some reason, the hectic atmosphere just doesn't bother me. It's fun and the interior is so cool. The food is amazing and the service is always great. I love taking people here from out of town. It's not a typical "go to" for tourists and for out of town guests but it should be!  No matter how busy it's been, we always get great service and amazing food. If you want some greasy bar food that's actually delicious and made well - this is the place to go. It's also just super fun and the location is SO convenient for lots of different activities you could be doing downtown.  Come here! Bring your friends! Order food and drinks! Stay and have a great time. I've never been disappointed after hanging out here whether it be for a meal with family or getting questionably inebriated with my friends. Highly recommend!

This really should get a higher rating because the food here is really good and beer is always fresh, cold and good but the bartenders are atrocious! I have never had  such bad service from a bartender in my life. Come here for the good food and better beer but be ready to be treated with indifference and inattentiveness.

We ate here for the first time today and loved it! Great atmosphere (though today was pretty crowded due to Crazylegs and the Farmer's Market) and great food! We tried the fried goat cheese curds (yes, GOAT cheese curds!) and they were every bit as delicious as they sound.  Maybe more. I had the portabella mushroom sandwich (which was delicious) and my husband had a burger with guacamole and jalepenos which he said was awesome, and an order of fries (decent, but nothing special). The food prices were very reasonable, too. We left feeling very full.  Probably too full for our own good, but it was totally worth it. I'd do it again. Eventually.  Maybe in a week or so when I'm finally hungry again after today....  We were seated by the window and with everything going on today, the people watching was AMAZING!  I would love to go back in the evening for drinks and hang out for a bit.   The only issue I had is that their restrooms are just single stall. So on a day like today when it was really crowded, there was a long line to use the restroom.  Middle of the day, everyone was fairly patient and all, but I could see how at night when lots of people are drinking, this could be an issue.
Great food, unique combinations & based on the location, you would expect higher prices!

Nice little bar that keeps a simple menu of burgers and basic apps turned up with a little Wisconsin flare (spotted cow beer battered fries and cheese curds). This place keeps a younger to middle aged crowd that is comfortable and fun. Wednesday was $3 New Glarus products which paired well with my "Tipsy Burger". For such a small place the food had good presentation and flavor. What I like most about this location is they know who they are, they own it and they don't try to be something they aren't.

Cute corner spot, we came here on a Friday night for some dinner.  We picked a table for 4, and we're told that the wait was about 45 minutes. They ended up calling us 5 minutes later saying our table was ready. I decided to order an average burger, everything was decent but the cheese curds were super crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside, definitely my favorite ones of all the cheese curds we had over our weekend in Madison!

3.5 -  I came to the Tipsy Cow for trivia! Our group shared some buffalo wings, which were deliciously hot. We also had several pitchers of Spotted Cow, which were $10 - That made me very happy! It was a great spot for a medium-large group, and the trivia was really fun.  The service was a bit slow, but it was also packed AND trivia was going on at the same time. Considering all that, I think the servers did a great job. There wasn't really a point we had to flag down our server. The women's restroom was out of service, causing some confusion at the men's single-stall, with men and women in line - Hopefully that will be fixed next time!  I want to try a burger here and explore more of their draft beer options.  I'd also be interested to see the atmosphere on a non-trivia night. Nice first experience!

I have been here twice and am still very impressed by this place. The menu has a great variety and everything I've tried is very tasty. Some of the best cheese curds around. I've also heard great things about the Korean fries. They have both indoor and outdoor seating which is a plus and the prices are reasonable.   My only complaint is the service. Both times they have been very sub-par. When it's 80 degrees and I'm sitting outside, I should not have to ask for a refill on water, especially when the server has been out to us once or twice already. Very slow, very unhelpful, and overall awkward service. Maybe she was new?   Despite that, I will definitely be back.
Great cheese curds and great service! They have a good selection of beers as well. The other food is pretty good, but not the best in the area.

My husband and I brought some friends from out of town for Trivia Night and fried cheese curds! The fried cheese curds delivered....they are small bites of heaven.  However, it was a little annoying because they advertised trivia on the website and had a huge sign by their front door that said trivia tonight! but when we arrived the hostess said there wasn't any because of the Packers game.  It's a pretty good excuse isn't it?  Other than the cheese curds, my meal was pretty horrible.  I ordered a salad with chicken and it was something I could have made at home for 49 cents....and the chicken was what I call "Subway chicken" and was the equivalent of what you get on a Subway sandwich, which is basically "meat product." My friends seemed overall pleased with their meals but I couldn't eat mine.

I have been here twice for lunch. Both times the service was extremely slow. There was no way that you could eat here if you just have an hour for lunch. On both occasions my food arrived and was not that hot. I ordered the Guinness pot pie the first time and the chicken club the second time.  I would say both of these meals were OK. I have not been here in the evening so perhaps it is different?
Has a great selection of beers on tap. We sat outside which was really nice. They have a good amount of seating outside.   Great, extensive beer menus with lots of craft, good beer.

After my previous visit at Tipsy Cow some time ago the owner Michael was kind enough to reach out with his apologies for my poor experience and offered me a $30 gift certificate.  I accepted and shared my thoughts with him regarding the experience, etc. I had the gift certificate in my possession shortly after.  I didn't however have a place to venture back until this past week; interesting considering I live 2 blocks away.  We were seated immediately although it was a busy time of day.  My friend and I each had 2 beers and split the zucchini coins with Tipsy sauce.  I had the reuben and she had the buffalo chicken sandwich.  I'd like to add that this is a different friend then the original experience and she has a higher tolerance for spice.  As usual the food was fine.  It met the need of greasy food and a beer to wash it down.  Our server was much better but moderate energy.  The service, etc certainly redeemed itself in comparison to last time  but I am still on the fence regarding any sort of regular patronage.  I do greatly appreciate being reached out to and being made to feel like my experience is important and valued.  Thank you Michael

I really love the Tipsy Cow!  It is the best place to get a bloody mary after visiting the farmers market on a Saturday morning.  Make sure to have bartender Ben make it for you! Their menu is great and they always have some intriguing appetizers.   Last time out we enjoyed the bacon & bleu cheese fries with our bloodies.  The Tipsy Cow is alwasys a treat!

Had a very tasty lunch here.  Top notch pork sandwich on delicious high quality bread with crispy bacon.  Enjoyed a very good order of cheese curds for an appetizer.  Companion had a chicken salad with avocados which was reported to be good.  Would definetly return.

No halves about it--solid four stars. Lengthy tap list. Host was a bit short but perhaps just not a Midwesterner!  Service in outside patio was swift and attentive. The pork tacos--good quality meat and flour tortillas. Truffle fries were well spiced but a bit too oily. Tipsy marg was refreshingly limey and tall. Condiments on table stored in well-worn, grungy cardboard 6-pack cartons. Nothing jumped out for dessert so a search elsewhere ensued...

Lots of artery clogging food (which can be a good thing or a bad thing depending on how you're feeling that day) and beer!  In my experience, the food is good but not remarkable, and centered on fried stuff (cheese curds, fries) and burgers.  One thing to keep in mind when looking at prices is that the sandwiches don't include sides.   Daily food and drink specials are also listed on the menu.  The ambiance includes 2 separate areas--an area that is all tables and another area which is more bar-like with seating at hte bar and some high tops.    My most recent visit was marred by a curdled drink.  A friend ordered a Bailey's with coffee.  Three of us tasted the drink and it was clearly off, perhaps curdled or otherwise spoiled.  For about 15 or so minutes we desperately tried to catch the eye of our server but failed. Friend returned drink to the bar and they re-made it and it was fine.  In short, Tipsy Cow works but I don't feel a pressing need to go out of my way to return.

This is one of my favorite places for fatty delicious bar food, so if that's what you're looking for, this is the spot! I have been about five times. The truffle fries and the goat cheese curds are must-have appetizers. I don't know of another place that offers goat cheese curds, which are a nice change from your usual (also delicious) curds. They always have some good beers on tap, too. This most recent time, I ordered a cheeseburger, and it was so good I had to write a review. Juicy patty clearly made by hand with cheddar cheese instead of American, grilled onions and some great pickle slices (thick, not too sweet or sour) for $6. It was the best burger I've had in Madison or in recent memory. The service is fine, usually not memorable. My most recent batch of truffle fries was not very truffle-y, so I asked the server about it and she took them back to have more truffle oil added, and then they were perfect.
Very good food. Sandwiches and accompaniments were great, cheese curds are some of the best in town. Staff could be a bit friendlier but otherwise service was good.
Trivia is an absolute blast here on Monday evenings.   They also have a super awesome cheese burger. The cheddar on it is to die for.   It's a great place to go with friends.

Stopped here for lunch and was a little disappointed (but let me preface by saying that I probably should have just gone to a restaurant and not a bar). I ordered the cheese curds and the salmon grilled cheese, and neither were as tasty as I was hoping.   The cheese curds were more breading than cheese, which was a let down since I'm visiting Wisconsin and therefore want the best cheese curds I've ever had. I went to the Old Fashioned last night and much prefer their cheese curds.   The salmon grilled cheese was just kind of meh - greasy and the flavor was a little harsh.   Service was fine and the vibe was cool. Don't get me wrong, nothing was actually bad about the food - I think my expectations were just high for a place that is clearly a bar first. I'd likely return for a beer or two.

I want to like Tipsy Cow more.  The location is great.  The few times I've been in, the crowd seems fun and the taplist is usuall solid.    But... well, this past Saturday afternoon, I stop in and ask the barkeep for a beer that's on the chalkboard tap list. The following conversation ensued...  barkeep: "Oh, we're out of that."  OK, I order a different beer.  barkeep: "Oh, that's gone, too."  So... what else is out of date on the tap list?  barkeep: "Oh, everything else is up to date."  OK, and what do you have on tap that isn't on the list?  barkeep: *blank stare* ... OK, I don't see Three Floyd's on the chalkboard, but there's a three floyd's tap. what 3F are you serving?  barkeep: "Uh it's an IPA"   ... I wait, since 3F has a bunch of different IPA/IIPA/DIPAs... barkeep:  "IPA means India Pale Ale" Thanks for mansplaining IPA to me in a completely non-helpful way. (If I didn't know what an IPA was, why would india pale ale help? come on.) And thanks for refusing to check the keg when I asked.    I usually try to visit a place a few times, and try to not let a single experience sour me, but it was a Saturday afternoon with very few customers. The bartender should know what beers are available, and telling me he didn't need to check the keg because it's an IPA is not helpful.  Having an out of date tap list is worse than not having a list at all, and the combination of the two was very frustrating.    I won't be going back to Tipsy Cow for a while, but hopefully they can work on improving the mediocre service.
Delicious burger and great beer selection! Visiting Madison from AZ and were glad we stopped in for a bite!

I can dig it.  We ended up coming here after waiting several minutes for a table at Graze that never came and seeing plenty of open booths and tables from the host table. Not about that waiting life. A quick yelp search and we found The Tipsy Cow as an alternative. Upon entering, we were seated promptly at a high top table near the bar. Outside patio was open when we had visited, but we were looking to cool down and catch some AC.  Pretty lively but not over crowded bar for a Saturday. Service was great and our waitress was prompt. Their draft beer selection consisted of maybe 10 or so options with maybe half local option (spotted cow, etc.) and some from as far as CA. Beers ran us $5.50 & $6.50 per pint and were so refreshing to have on a hot day.  For food... I did their smoked salmon grilled cheese ~ generous portions of smoked salmon stuffed between two slices of bread with gruyere cheese, traditional red onions, & lathered with lemon-caper aioli. Tasty and unique twist on a grilled cheese & lox and not bad for $9. And of course when in Wisconsin, an order of fried cheese curds to share. Perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside and a tad gooey on the inside and served with ranch for dipping.  Anyways, if you're looking for a casual spot to grab a bite or drinks near the Capital building, I'd definitely give this one a try.  'Til next time, cheers!   161/365
Underwhelming food, underwhelming bar, good location, good trivia night.... that being said, for any given item at any given price better can be found elsewhere in Madison.

Stopped at the Tipsy Cow by default, to escape from the rain, and impending storm. We had never eaten at this restaurant before, and I was actually pleasantly surprised. We were seated by the window in the bar room. We were able to watch the storm with relief as we enjoyed the delicious food and upbeat atmosphere. Our friendly waitress informed us that we could order half a salad as well as half an order of appetizers, which is just what we did. So glad she mentioned that option, because I was able to order the beet salad that I really wanted, as well as the truffle fries from the menu that were calling out to me. Both were absolutely delicious, and both half orders were plentiful! The beet salad consisted of chopped roasted beets mixed among a chopped lettuce mix, toasted pistachios (yum!), blue cheese and sliced red onions. Served on the side was a beet vinaigrette which I really didn't need as the salad was already tossed with a nice light dressing. I only have one tiny complaint. I would have preferred to have less red onion vs. as much as was included on the salad. A little onion overkill for me, but otherwise it really was wonderful. Now, on to the truffle fries.... absolutely fantastic! They were crunchy and delicious, tossed in truffle oil. Really heavenly, dipped in the garlic aioli that was served on the side. Very addicting! I'm very glad we were kind of forced to test this restaurant/bar out, and I plan to stop by again sometime. There are plenty more items on the menu I'd love to try.

This place is great! One of the best burgers in Madison. They keep it simple with the burgers, but totally deliver on taste. The also have really good cheese curds. Perfectly breaded on the outside and the cheese is melted all the way through in the inside. Definitely worth a try.   They have a good beer list that usually has options you can't normally find at bars.

I just moved to town and my sister came to visit so we went down to the square and ended up in the Tipsy Cow during the dinner rush. We got seated immediately, and got drinks and food quickly. My burger was fantastic. We had a great time!

Nice quiet small place. Close to the Capital. Service was good. Had the alligator bites, and the Walleye fish sandwich along with bacon and blue cheese fries.  The sandwiches are sold separately from the fries.  The serving size was a good portion   As you can see from the picture, the fish was bigger then the bun  Ordered only one fry basket and that was enough for our table.  The alligator bites had a great flavor Enjoyed the bourbon peach mule. I would drop in again

WOW!  We wandered in on a whim and were blown any by the food.  They definitely have the best burgers around!!  The onion rings were super sized and delicious!  The service was fast, but they could improve their dress code.   Try them out and enjoy!!  July 2017 - Update!  Still the best burgers in town!!!  I also really enjoyed the outdoor seating.

You guys...so good. Started off our dinner with goat cheese curds. They were exactly as amazing as you think they would be. Beautifully melty inside, great flavor, not too much breading. Then we shared a half order of carnitas fries, and I had a Tipsy-Q. The fries were awesome. Perfect amount of everything in every bite. The Tipsy-Q? I wasn't a huge fan. I'm not sure if it was the slaw or the sauce, but some component was sweet--but it was an odd sweet. Not the typical bbq sauce sweetness.   But the dranks. I looooooved the dranks. One in particular--I think It was called the bourbon peach mule? It. Was. Amazing. So perfect in every way that I racked up a $30ish bar tab drinking them. Slightly peach, slightly lime, slightly fizzy.   And the service was fantastic. I love places that get that right balance of stopping by the table often enough but not being too intrusive. Our server was amazing.  I will definitely be coming back to try the Korean bbq fries. And more dranks!

Accessibility - 3 Atmosphere - 4 Taste - 4 Customer Service - 4 Value - 4 Average - 3.8 (4 stars)  I found this tiny Capitol-side restaurant charming. The food is well worth the price and I've made it a point to visit again.

Tried this place 6 months ago when new to Madison area. I really wanted cheese curds but hubby was overloaded with cheese. Haha.   Service: Host was fine. Male waiter was fine. No one was that friendly & inviting but then again they weren't rude either. Like I said, fine.   Food: I ordered a fish taco and the Korean BBQ fries. Fries were not bad. Too much sauce though. A bit salty. While the fish taco did lack taste. I'm coming from CA, of course I've had better. Lol.   Ambiance: Not a place I would bring my kids to. Maybe some friends or relatives visiting to have some food to share and have a drink.   I would come back again eventually and try something else.

Always a great atmosphere at the Tipsy Cow.  They have delicious burgers (their famous tipsy burger) and great appetizers. Try their goat cheese curds if you want to be a little adventurous.  There's great outdoor seating with a nice view of the Capitol.

Best cheese curds in Wisconsin. Reasonable prices, friendly, quality beef, generous with crispy bacon. Definitely recommend the Tipsy Burger. Service can be a little slow but usually just because they are very busy not because they aren't working hard. Clean and friendly. Love this local place.

Stopped by here today for lunch for my first ever fried cheese curds!! I just had to see what all the hubbub was about. And I have to say that fried cheese curds are like better mozzarella sticks, since it's 90% cheese! Especially since Wisconsin has the best and freshest cheeses...  Fried cheese curds were delicious. And my sister loved her local lamb burger. My tipsy burger was also delicious and very filling. The meat was cooked perfectly but there was a lot of excess liquid in my burger, compared to my sister who had an egg in hers. But it was good regardless. We also shared a basket of fries and those were good as well.  Service was a little slow but they were pretty busy and also I know our waitress was slammed with tables. She did the best that she could. Overall I had a very pleasant experience and glad that I chose tipsy cow for my first fried cheese curd experience!
I had the Famous Onion Rings.  It is like eating a doughnut with a sliver of onion in it.  Not for me, maybe others, but not me.  Nothing really wows here, basically still the Local Tavern.

I have been to the Tipsy Cow twice, the first time was a few years ago. At the time we got cheese curds, which I thought were on par with some of the best in town-fresh and delicious. I also had a warm sandwich with Turkey and Havarti on it, also delicious! Now that was some time ago and I have always held the restaurant in high regard even though I hadn't made my way back.... until recently. I don't know if their food has gone downhill or if these particular items I  had this time were always lame. We stopped in for a beer and a couple appetizers to get out of the cold,  we ordered pretzels w/ cheese and a basket of buffalo french fries. Expecting some homemade pretzel and cheese dip,  we were presented with 4 store-bought, frozen pretzels. We paid $9 for 4 of the exact pretzels I could have bought at Woodman's for $2.29. The fries were OK, they were generic waffles fries you can get at most bars- very tasty for sure but nothing special. Good fries that were drenched in Frank's Red Hot and a blue cheese salad dressing. They were fine, I guess, but I expected and hoped for something a little more thoughtful in the menu and food. Good beer selection though!

When you're on a pup crawl this place it a definite place to crawl through.  Love the name, the vibe, the drinks and the food here.  Second visit was as much fun as the first!  Sat at the bar with my friends and ordered a Grey Goose on ice.  Holy crap, talk about liberal pours and cool pricing.  Guess I've lived in Hawaii so long I expect a skimpy 1.5 ounce top shelf drink to cost a minimum $16.  This was a liberal 3 ounce at $8.  The Peach Mule, menu drink, was awesome.  Any beer on tap can be tasted before you buy which is a fantastic offer for serious beer drinkers.  A lot of old favorites on the food menu with new twists, prepared well and served by happy-to-be-there servers.  The Tipsy Cow Burger is off the charts good.  The Fried Curds, tasty.  The Beer Battered Onion Rings were thick and probably the best I've ever consumed.  Beautiful, thick, crisp....I'm drooling just writing this.  My favorite thing served (next to those awesome Onion Rings) was Mike's Pickles.  A menu item that had me begging for a jar, gallon please, to take home to Hawaii.  Unfortunately the pickles are a secret recipe and the not sold in any jar containers.  Tried to get the recipe but that was not to be bought or given.  I will return next trip to Madison.  Definitely a fantastic place to have a couple of drinks and have a great meal too.

This is an update to my original review.  First of all I was very impressed when the owner, Michael Banas, offered me a $20 gift certificate to come back since in the first review I complained about our service.  I was finally able to get back there yesterday and things have improved.  This time around I had the Griddled Turkey and Havarti on sour dough and my dining companion had the Tipsy Chicken - crispy.  Both sandwiches were excellent, mine had a huge stack of turkey and the bread was excellent and grilled nicely.  The Tipsy Chicken also received rave reviews, no skimping on the chicken patty and sandwich was like it just came out of the pan.  Sandwiches are ala carte, so we ordered a large order of beer battered fries on the recommendation of our server.  She said the large would be better for sharing.  Unfortunately, neither of us cared for the fries, so the small would have been a better choice.  Our main complaint is they were cold when they arrived.  Service was definitely better than our first visit, our waitress checked back with us, refilled water and was for the most part attentive.  However, after we were finished and she cleared our table it was at least 10 minutes until she returned with the bill.  Even with this small glitch, she was head and shoulders above the server from my first visit.  My one other small complaint is the lack of ice in the water...it is just my preference, and there was plenty of ice in the soda, so I am not sure why there isn't more in the water.  But again, that is just my personal preference.  Thanks, Michael, for buying me lunch and keeping your word of making some service changes.  Griddled Turkey and Havarti is a solid choice if you are looking for a yummy sandwich.
Fried cheese curds were some of the best I have ever had. Beer menu was a little limited and could have had more local and regional brews.

Occassion: Dinner with friends Food: tipsy cheeseburger, cheese curds, truffle fries Thoughts: Friendly service, food was good. Came on trivia night (8-10pm) - wasn't planned, but the trivia headmaster got us into it. It was $10 pitchers when we went.

What an awesome spot on the square!  We visited tonight and will definitely be going back soon.  We had the blue cheese and bacon fries as an appetizer...insane...the bacon was perfectly crispy and the fries were super crisp.  I had the guacamole burger which was the perfect blend of grilled burger, avocado, and zesty spice with pepper jack cheese on a grilled bun.  My husband had the kielbasa with zingy kraut and mustard...also amazing.  Great selection of tap and bottled beer...reasonably priced...one of our new favorite spots!!!

Great no-frills burger here. The goat cheese curds are a great dish which I had not seen before. Loaded fries are a nice choice here as well. Beer selection is plentiful. Difficult to get a table at times, not a big surprise in this location.

5-star review for a not 5-star restaurant...Nor should it be. Tipsy is my favorite downtown Madison pub for a greasy delicious 'Merican meal. They excel at their staple burger...The Tipsy burger and my newly found favorite Korean Beef sandwich.    But in my humble eyes, I think they're sweetspot is their appetizer menu. The best option, though it may sound boring, is the French fries. They have bacon and bleu (our favorite), Korean BBQ fries, and barbeque ranch just to name a few. And they come smothered in whatever toppings you choose with enough to feed a table. Second to that, I'd try the cheese curds and if you're feeling crazy try the alligator bites.   Then of course, this is a true Wisconwin tavern, so you've got a full selection of craft beers at your disposal. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Very tasty.  Had the St. Germain & gin specialty cocktail--delicious and refreshing.  Truffle fries we shared - very tasty.  My friend commented that they are big on aioli here--true.    I had the creamy tomato soup and was delighted with the promised "smoky and spicy" flavors, along with the squeaky cheese curds garnishing the soup.  My grilled tilapia sandwich was generously portioned and cooked nicely, and the roll it was served on was pleasantly soft and chewy (Clasen's bread I believe?).    The service was prompt, attentive, and friendly.  The prices were right.  I'll definitely be back!
Best onion rings and and cheese curds!! Burgers were amazing too!! Great service and staff were all very nice!

On Saturday mornings during the Farmer's Market we usually stop to have Bloody Mary's and have some lunch. On last day of the Market, we tried something new and went to the Tipsy Cow. As the unfriendly bartender greeted us without eye contact, he asked my group "What can I get you?" he scooped the glass of ice out of the ice bin with the glass he was mixing the drink in, I pointed out a crack in the glass. This must have annoyed him and her threw the galss in the trash without simply replying "Hey thanks for pointing that out to me."  We were greeted at our table by our server after a 5 minute wait. No smile, no welcome, nothing - "What can I get you?" The water glasses were brought over, another chip in the glass. Again no comment, she just whisked it away as if we were inconveniencing her. However, the food was hot and delicious and served in a timely manner. Next timw I will come to enjoy my food but only order bottled beverages. The ice bin could be full of glass from scraping the glass through the bin. Big no-no in the food/beverage industry. By the way, I am calling the Health Department and reporting this incident.
